00027 /* Primary entry points from LNET.  There are no guarantees against reentrance. */
00028 lnd_t the_kgnilnd = {
00029 #ifdef CONFIG_CRAY_XT
00030         .lnd_type       = GNILND,
00031 #else
00032         .lnd_type       = GNIIPLND,
00033 #endif
00034         .lnd_startup    = kgnilnd_startup,
00035         .lnd_shutdown   = kgnilnd_shutdown,
00036         .lnd_ctl        = kgnilnd_ctl,
00037         .lnd_send       = kgnilnd_send,
00038         .lnd_recv       = kgnilnd_recv,
00039         .lnd_eager_recv = kgnilnd_eager_recv,
00040         .lnd_query      = kgnilnd_query,
00041 };

00043 kgn_data_t      kgnilnd_data;

00045 int
00046 kgnilnd_thread_start(int(*fn)(void *arg), void *arg, char *name, int id)
00047 {
00048         struct task_struct *thrd;
00049 
00050         thrd = kthread_run(fn, arg, "%s_%02d", name, id);
00051         if (IS_ERR(thrd))
00052                 return PTR_ERR(thrd);
00053 
00054         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads);
00055         return 0;
00056 }
00057 
00058 /* bind scheduler threads to cpus */
00059 int
00060 kgnilnd_start_sd_threads(void)
00061 {
00062         int cpu;
00063         int i = 0;
00064         struct task_struct *task;
00065 
00066         for_each_online_cpu(cpu) {
00067                 /* don't bind to cpu 0 - all interrupts are processed here */
00068                 if (cpu == 0)
00069                         continue;
00070 
00071                 task = kthread_create(kgnilnd_scheduler, (void *)((long)i),
00072                                       "%s_%02d", "kgnilnd_sd", i);
00073                 if (!IS_ERR(task)) {
00074                         kthread_bind(task, cpu);
00075                         wake_up_process(task);
00076                 } else {
00077                         CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd scheduler[%d] %ld\n", i,
00078                                 PTR_ERR(task));
00079                         return PTR_ERR(task);
00080                 }
00081                 atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads);
00082 
00083                 if (++i >= *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_threads) {
00084                         break;
00085                 }
00086         }
00087 
00088         return 0;
00089 }

00091 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
00092 int
00093 kgnilnd_close_stale_conns_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, kgn_conn_t *newconn)
00094 {
00095         kgn_conn_t         *conn;
00096         struct list_head   *ctmp, *cnxt;
00097         int                 loopback;
00098         int                 count = 0;
00099 
00100         loopback = peer->gnp_nid == peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni->ni_nid;
00101 
00102         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->gnp_conns) {
00103                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kgn_conn_t, gnc_list);
00104 
00105                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00106                         continue;
00107 
00108                 if (conn == newconn)
00109                         continue;
00110 
00111                 if (conn->gnc_device != newconn->gnc_device)
00112                         continue;
00113 
00114                 /* This is a two connection loopback - one talking to the other */
00115                 if (loopback &&
00116                     newconn->gnc_my_connstamp == conn->gnc_peer_connstamp &&
00117                     newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp == conn->gnc_my_connstamp) {
00118                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "skipping prune of %p, "
00119                                 "loopback and matching stamps"
00120                                 " connstamp "LPU64"("LPU64")"
00121                                 " peerstamp "LPU64"("LPU64")\n",
00122                                 conn, newconn->gnc_my_connstamp,
00123                                 conn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
00124                                 newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
00125                                 conn->gnc_my_connstamp);
00126                         continue;
00127                 }
00128 
00129                 if (conn->gnc_peerstamp != newconn->gnc_peerstamp) {
00130                         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_peerstamp < newconn->gnc_peerstamp,
00131                                 "conn 0x%p peerstamp "LPU64" >= "
00132                                 "newconn 0x%p peerstamp "LPU64"\n",
00133                                 conn, conn->gnc_peerstamp,
00134                                 newconn, newconn->gnc_peerstamp);
00135 
00136                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Closing stale conn nid: %s "
00137                                " peerstamp:"LPX64"("LPX64")\n",
00138                                libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
00139                                conn->gnc_peerstamp, newconn->gnc_peerstamp);
00140                 } else {
00141 
00142                         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_peer_connstamp < newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
00143                                 "conn 0x%p peer_connstamp "LPU64" >= "
00144                                 "newconn 0x%p peer_connstamp "LPU64"\n",
00145                                 conn, conn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
00146                                 newconn, newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp);
00147 
00148                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Closing stale conn nid: %s"
00149                                " connstamp:"LPU64"("LPU64")\n",
00150                                libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
00151                                conn->gnc_peer_connstamp, newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp);
00152                 }
00153 
00154                 count++;
00155                 kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ESTALE);
00156         }
00157 
00158         if (count != 0) {
00159                 CWARN("Closed %d stale conns to %s\n", count, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
00160         }
00161 
00162         RETURN(count);
00163 }
00164 
00165 int
00166 kgnilnd_conn_isdup_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, kgn_conn_t *newconn)
00167 {
00168         kgn_conn_t       *conn;
00169         struct list_head *tmp;
00170         int               loopback;
00171         ENTRY;
00172 
00173         loopback = peer->gnp_nid == peer->gnp_net->gnn_ni->ni_nid;
00174 
00175         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->gnp_conns) {
00176                 conn = list_entry(tmp, kgn_conn_t, gnc_list);
00177                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "checking conn 0x%p for peer %s"
00178                         " lo %d new "LPU64" existing "LPU64
00179                         " new peer "LPU64" existing peer "LPU64
00180                         " new dev %p existing dev %p\n",
00181                         conn, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
00182                         loopback,
00183                         newconn->gnc_peerstamp, conn->gnc_peerstamp,
00184                         newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp, conn->gnc_peer_connstamp,
00185                         newconn->gnc_device, conn->gnc_device);
00186 
00187                 /* conn is in the process of closing */
00188                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00189                         continue;
00190 
00191                 /* 'newconn' is from an earlier version of 'peer'!!! */
00192                 if (newconn->gnc_peerstamp < conn->gnc_peerstamp)
00193                         RETURN(1);
00194 
00195                 /* 'conn' is from an earlier version of 'peer': it will be
00196                  * removed when we cull stale conns later on... */
00197                 if (newconn->gnc_peerstamp > conn->gnc_peerstamp)
00198                         continue;
00199 
00200                 /* Different devices are OK */
00201                 if (conn->gnc_device != newconn->gnc_device)
00202                         continue;
00203 
00204                 /* It's me connecting to myself */
00205                 if (loopback &&
00206                     newconn->gnc_my_connstamp == conn->gnc_peer_connstamp &&
00207                     newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp == conn->gnc_my_connstamp)
00208                         continue;
00209 
00210                 /* 'newconn' is an earlier connection from 'peer'!!! */
00211                 if (newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp < conn->gnc_peer_connstamp)
00212                         RETURN(2);
00213 
00214                 /* 'conn' is an earlier connection from 'peer': it will be
00215                  * removed when we cull stale conns later on... */
00216                 if (newconn->gnc_peer_connstamp > conn->gnc_peer_connstamp)
00217                         continue;
00218 
00219                 /* 'newconn' has the SAME connection stamp; 'peer' isn't
00220                  * playing the game... */
00221                 RETURN(3);
00222         }
00223 
00224         RETURN(0);
00225 }
00226 
00227 int
00228 kgnilnd_create_conn(kgn_conn_t **connp, kgn_device_t *dev)
00229 {
00230         kgn_conn_t      *conn;
00231         gni_return_t    rrc;
00232         int             rc = 0;
00233 
00234         LASSERT (!in_interrupt());
00235         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns);
00236 
00237         /* divide by 2 to allow for complete reset and immediate reconnect */
00238         if (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns) >= GNILND_MAX_CQID/2) {
00239                 CERROR("Too many conn are live: %d > %d\n",
00240                         atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns), GNILND_MAX_CQID/2);
00241                 atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns);
00242                 return -E2BIG;
00243         }
00244 
00245         LIBCFS_ALLOC(conn, sizeof(*conn));
00246         if (conn == NULL) {
00247                 atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns);
00248                 return -ENOMEM;
00249         }
00250 
00251         conn->gnc_tx_ref_table =
00252                 kgnilnd_vzalloc(GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID * sizeof(void *));
00253         if (conn->gnc_tx_ref_table == NULL) {
00254                 CERROR("Can't allocate conn tx_ref_table\n");
00255                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
00256         }
00257 
00258         mutex_init(&conn->gnc_smsg_mutex);
00259         mutex_init(&conn->gnc_rdma_mutex);
00260         atomic_set(&conn->gnc_refcount, 1);
00261         atomic_set(&conn->gnc_reaper_noop, 0);
00262         atomic_set(&conn->gnc_sched_noop, 0);
00263         atomic_set(&conn->gnc_tx_in_use, 0);
00264         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->gnc_list);
00265         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->gnc_hashlist);
00266         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->gnc_schedlist);
00267         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->gnc_fmaq);
00268         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->gnc_mdd_list);
00269         spin_lock_init(&conn->gnc_list_lock);
00270         spin_lock_init(&conn->gnc_tx_lock);
00271         conn->gnc_magic = GNILND_CONN_MAGIC;
00272 
00273         /* set tx id to nearly the end to make sure we find wrapping
00274          * issues soon */
00275         conn->gnc_next_tx = (int) GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID - 10;
00276 
00277         /* if this fails, we have conflicts and MAX_TX is too large */
00278         CLASSERT(GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID < GNILND_MSGID_CLOSE);
00279 
00280         /* get a new unique CQ id for this conn */
00281         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00282         conn->gnc_my_connstamp = kgnilnd_data.kgn_connstamp++;
00283         conn->gnc_cqid = kgnilnd_get_cqid_locked();
00284         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00285 
00286         if (conn->gnc_cqid == 0) {
00287                 CERROR("Could not allocate unique CQ ID for conn 0x%p\n", conn);
00288                 GOTO(failed, rc = -E2BIG);
00289         }
00290 
00291         CDEBUG(D_NET, "alloc cqid %u for conn 0x%p\n",
00292                 conn->gnc_cqid, conn);
00293 
00294         /* need to be set before gnc_ephandle to allow kgnilnd_destroy_conn_ep to
00295          * check context */
00296         conn->gnc_device = dev;
00297 
00298         conn->gnc_timeout = MAX(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout,
00299                                 GNILND_MIN_TIMEOUT);
00300         kgnilnd_update_reaper_timeout(conn->gnc_timeout);
00301 
00302         /* this is the ep_handle for doing SMSG & BTE */
00303         mutex_lock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
00304         rrc = kgnilnd_ep_create(dev->gnd_handle, dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh,
00305                                 &conn->gnc_ephandle);
00306         mutex_unlock(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
00307         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS)
00308                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENETDOWN);
00309 
00310         CDEBUG(D_NET, "created conn 0x%p ep_hndl 0x%p\n",
00311                conn, conn->gnc_ephandle);
00312 
00313         /* add ref for EP canceling */
00314         kgnilnd_conn_addref(conn);
00315         atomic_inc(&dev->gnd_neps);
00316 
00317         *connp = conn;
00318         return 0;
00319 
00320 failed:
00321         atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns);
00322         LIBCFS_FREE(conn->gnc_tx_ref_table, GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID * sizeof(void *));
00323         LIBCFS_FREE(conn, sizeof(*conn));
00324         return rc;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /* needs to be called with kgn_peer_conn_lock held (read or write) */
00328 kgn_conn_t *
00329 kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer)
00330 {
00331         kgn_conn_t      *conn = NULL;
00332 
00333         /* if we are in reset, this conn is going to die soon */
00334         if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset)) {
00335                 RETURN(NULL);
00336         }
00337 
00338         /* just return the first ESTABLISHED connection */
00339         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
00340                 /* kgnilnd_finish_connect doesn't put connections on the
00341                  * peer list until they are actually established */
00342                 LASSERTF(conn->gnc_state >= GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED,
00343                         "found conn %p state %s on peer %p (%s)\n",
00344                         conn, kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn), peer,
00345                         libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
00346                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
00347                         continue;
00348 
00349                 RETURN(conn);
00350         }
00351         RETURN(NULL);
00352 }
00353 
00354 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
00355 kgn_conn_t *
00356 kgnilnd_find_or_create_conn_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer) {
00357 
00358         kgn_device_t    *dev = peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev;
00359         kgn_conn_t      *conn;
00360 
00361         conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
00362 
00363         if (conn != NULL) {
00364                 return conn;
00365         }
00366 
00367         /* if the peer was previously connecting, check if we should
00368          * trigger another connection attempt yet. */
00369         if (time_before(jiffies, peer->gnp_reconnect_time)) {
00370                 return NULL;
00371         }
00372 
00373         /* This check prevents us from creating a new connection to a peer while we are
00374          * still in the process of closing an existing connection to the peer.
00375          */
00376         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
00377                 if (conn->gnc_ephandle != NULL) {
00378                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Not connecting non-null ephandle found peer 0x%p->%s\n", peer,
00379                                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
00380                         return NULL;
00381                 }
00382         }
00383 
00384         if (peer->gnp_connecting != GNILND_PEER_IDLE) {
00385                 /* if we are not connecting, fire up a new connection */
00386                 /* or if we are anything but IDLE DONT start a new connection */
00387                return NULL;
00388         }
00389 
00390         CDEBUG(D_NET, "starting connect to %s\n",
00391                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
00392         peer->gnp_connecting = GNILND_PEER_CONNECT;
00393         kgnilnd_peer_addref(peer); /* extra ref for connd */
00394 
00395         spin_lock(&dev->gnd_connd_lock);
00396         list_add_tail(&peer->gnp_connd_list, &dev->gnd_connd_peers);
00397         spin_unlock(&dev->gnd_connd_lock);
00398 
00399         kgnilnd_schedule_dgram(dev);
00400         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "scheduling new connect\n");
00401 
00402         return NULL;
00403 }
00404 
00405 /* Caller is responsible for deciding if/when to call this */
00406 void
00407 kgnilnd_destroy_conn_ep(kgn_conn_t *conn)
00408 {
00409         gni_return_t    rrc;
00410         gni_ep_handle_t tmp_ep;
00411 
00412         /* only if we actually initialized it,
00413          *  then set NULL to tell kgnilnd_destroy_conn to leave it alone */
00414 
00415         tmp_ep = xchg(&conn->gnc_ephandle, NULL);
00416         if (tmp_ep != NULL) {
00417                 /* we never re-use the EP, so unbind is not needed */
00418                 mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
00419                 rrc = kgnilnd_ep_destroy(tmp_ep);
00420 
00421                 mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
00422 
00423                 /* if this fails, it could hork up kgni smsg retransmit and others
00424                  * since we could free the SMSG mbox memory, etc. */
00425                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS, "rrc %d conn 0x%p ep 0x%p\n",
00426                          rrc, conn, conn->gnc_ephandle);
00427 
00428                 atomic_dec(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_neps);
00429 
00430                 /* clear out count added in kgnilnd_close_conn_locked
00431                  * conn will have a peer once it hits finish_connect, where it
00432                  * is the first spot we'll mark it ESTABLISHED as well */
00433                 if (conn->gnc_peer) {
00434                         kgnilnd_admin_decref(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_dirty_eps);
00435                 }
00436 
00437                 /* drop ref for EP */
00438                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
00439         }
00440 }
00441 
00442 void
00443 kgnilnd_destroy_conn(kgn_conn_t *conn)
00444 {
00445         LASSERTF(!in_interrupt() &&
00446                 !conn->gnc_scheduled &&
00447                 !conn->gnc_in_purgatory &&
00448                 conn->gnc_ephandle == NULL &&
00449                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_list) &&
00450                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_hashlist) &&
00451                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_schedlist) &&
00452                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_mdd_list) &&
00453                 conn->gnc_magic == GNILND_CONN_MAGIC,
00454                 "conn 0x%p->%s IRQ %d sched %d purg %d ep 0x%p Mg %d lists %d/%d/%d/%d\n",
00455                 conn, conn->gnc_peer ? libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid)
00456                                      : "<?>",
00457                 !!in_interrupt(), conn->gnc_scheduled,
00458                 conn->gnc_in_purgatory,
00459                 conn->gnc_ephandle,
00460                 conn->gnc_magic,
00461                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_list),
00462                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_hashlist),
00463                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_schedlist),
00464                 list_empty(&conn->gnc_mdd_list));
00465 
00466         /* Tripping these is especially bad, as it means we have items on the
00467          *  lists that didn't keep their refcount on the connection - or
00468          *  somebody evil released their own */
00469         LASSERTF(list_empty(&conn->gnc_fmaq) &&
00470                  atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_fma) == 0 &&
00471                  atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_rdma) == 0,
00472                  "conn 0x%p fmaq %d@0x%p nfma %d nrdma %d\n",
00473                  conn, kgnilnd_count_list(&conn->gnc_fmaq), &conn->gnc_fmaq,
00474                  atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_fma), atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_rdma));
00475 
00476         CDEBUG(D_NET, "destroying conn %p ephandle %p error %d\n",
00477                 conn, conn->gnc_ephandle, conn->gnc_error);
00478 
00479         /* We are freeing this memory remove the magic value from the connection */
00480         conn->gnc_magic = 0;
00481 
00482         /* if there is an FMA blk left here, we'll tear it down */
00483         if (conn->gnc_fma_blk) {
00484                 if (conn->gnc_peer) {
00485                         kgn_mbox_info_t *mbox;
00486                         mbox = &conn->gnc_fma_blk->gnm_mbox_info[conn->gnc_mbox_id];
00487                         mbox->mbx_prev_nid = conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid;
00488                 }
00489                 kgnilnd_release_mbox(conn, 0);
00490         }
00491 
00492         if (conn->gnc_peer != NULL)
00493                 kgnilnd_peer_decref(conn->gnc_peer);
00494 
00495         if (conn->gnc_tx_ref_table != NULL) {
00496                 LIBCFS_FREE(conn->gnc_tx_ref_table,
00497                             GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID * sizeof(void *));
00498         }
00499 
00500         LIBCFS_FREE(conn, sizeof(*conn));
00501         atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns);
00502 }
00503 
00504 /* peer_alive and peer_notify done in the style of the o2iblnd */
00505 void
00506 kgnilnd_peer_alive(kgn_peer_t *peer)
00507 {
00508         set_mb(peer->gnp_last_alive, jiffies);
00509 }
00510 
00511 void
00512 kgnilnd_peer_notify(kgn_peer_t *peer, int error, int alive)
00513 {
00514         int                     tell_lnet = 0;
00515         int                     nnets = 0;
00516         int                     rc;
00517         int                     i, j;
00518         kgn_conn_t             *conn;
00519         kgn_net_t             **nets;
00520         kgn_net_t              *net;
00521 
00522 
00523         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_DONT_NOTIFY))
00524                 return;
00525 
00526         /* Tell LNet we are giving ups on this peer - but only
00527          * if it isn't already reconnected or trying to reconnect */
00528         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00529 
00530         /* use kgnilnd_find_conn_locked to avoid any conns in the process of being nuked
00531          *
00532          * don't tell LNet if we are in reset - we assume that everyone will be able to
00533          * reconnect just fine
00534          */
00535         conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
00536 
00537         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "peer 0x%p->%s ting %d conn 0x%p, rst %d error %d\n",
00538                peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer->gnp_connecting, conn,
00539                kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset, error);
00540 
00541         if (((peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_IDLE) &&
00542             (conn == NULL) &&
00543             (!kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset) &&
00544             (!kgnilnd_conn_clean_errno(error))) || alive) {
00545                 tell_lnet = 1;
00546         }
00547 
00548         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00549 
00550         if (!tell_lnet) {
00551                 /* short circuit if we dont need to notify Lnet */
00552                 return;
00553         }
00554 
00555         rc = down_read_trylock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
00556 
00557         if (rc) {
00558             /* dont do this if this fails since LNET is in shutdown or something else
00559              */
00560 
00561                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
00562                         list_for_each_entry(net , &kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i], gnn_list) {
00563                                 /* if gnn_shutdown set for any net shutdown is in progress just return */
00564                                 if (net->gnn_shutdown) {
00565                                         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
00566                                         return;
00567                                 }
00568                                 nnets++;
00569                         }
00570                 }
00571 
00572                 if (nnets == 0) {
00573                         /* shutdown in progress most likely */
00574                         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
00575                         return;
00576                 }
00577 
00578                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(nets, nnets * sizeof(*nets));
00579 
00580                 if (nets == NULL) {
00581                         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
00582                         CERROR("Failed to allocate nets[%d]\n", nnets);
00583                         return;
00584                 }
00585 
00586                 j = 0;
00587                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
00588                         list_for_each_entry(net, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i], gnn_list) {
00589                                 nets[j] = net;
00590                                 kgnilnd_net_addref(net);
00591                                 j++;
00592                         }
00593                 }
00594                 up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
00595 
00596                 for (i = 0; i < nnets; i++) {
00597                         lnet_nid_t peer_nid;
00598 
00599                         net = nets[i];
00600 
00601                         peer_nid = kgnilnd_lnd2lnetnid(net->gnn_ni->ni_nid,
00602                                                                  peer->gnp_nid);
00603 
00604                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer 0x%p->%s last_alive %lu (%lus ago)\n",
00605                                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), peer->gnp_last_alive,
00606                                 cfs_duration_sec(jiffies - peer->gnp_last_alive));
00607 
00608                         lnet_notify(net->gnn_ni, peer_nid, alive,
00609                                     peer->gnp_last_alive);
00610 
00611                         kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
00612                 }
00613 
00614                 LIBCFS_FREE(nets, nnets * sizeof(*nets));
00615         }
00616 }
00617 
00618 /* need write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
00619 void
00620 kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(kgn_conn_t *conn, int error)
00621 {
00622         kgn_peer_t        *peer = conn->gnc_peer;
00623         ENTRY;
00624 
00625         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
00626 
00627         /* store error for tx completion */
00628         conn->gnc_error = error;
00629         peer->gnp_last_errno = error;
00630 
00631         /* use real error from peer if possible */
00632         if (error == -ECONNRESET) {
00633                 error = conn->gnc_peer_error;
00634         }
00635 
00636         /* if we NETERROR, make sure it is rate limited */
00637         if (!kgnilnd_conn_clean_errno(error) &&
00638             peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP) {
00639                 CNETERR("closing conn to %s: error %d\n",
00640                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), error);
00641         } else {
00642                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "closing conn to %s: error %d\n",
00643                        libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), error);
00644         }
00645 
00646         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED,
00647                 "conn %p to %s with bogus state %s\n", conn,
00648                 libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
00649                 kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
00650         LASSERT(!list_empty(&conn->gnc_hashlist));
00651         LASSERT(!list_empty(&conn->gnc_list));
00652 
00653 
00654         /* mark peer count here so any place the EP gets destroyed will
00655          * open up the peer count so that a new ESTABLISHED conn is then free
00656          * to send new messages -- sending before the previous EPs are destroyed
00657          * could end up with messages on the network for the old conn _after_
00658          * the new conn and break the mbox safety protocol */
00659         kgnilnd_admin_addref(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_dirty_eps);
00660 
00661         /* Remove from conn hash table: no new callbacks */
00662         list_del_init(&conn->gnc_hashlist);
00663         kgnilnd_data.kgn_conn_version++;
00664         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
00665 
00666         /* if we are in reset, go right to CLOSED as there is no scheduler
00667          * thread to move from CLOSING to CLOSED */
00668         if (unlikely(kgnilnd_data.kgn_in_reset)) {
00669                 conn->gnc_state = GNILND_CONN_CLOSED;
00670         } else {
00671                 conn->gnc_state = GNILND_CONN_CLOSING;
00672         }
00673 
00674         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RDMA_CQ_ERROR)) {
00675                 msleep_interruptible(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00676         }
00677 
00678         /* leave on peer->gnp_conns to make sure we don't let the reaper
00679          * or others try to unlink this peer until the conn is fully
00680          * processed for closing */
00681 
00682         if (kgnilnd_check_purgatory_conn(conn)) {
00683                 kgnilnd_add_purgatory_locked(conn, conn->gnc_peer);
00684         }
00685 
00686         /* Reset RX timeout to ensure we wait for an incoming CLOSE
00687          * for the full timeout.  If we get a CLOSE we know the
00688          * peer has stopped all RDMA.  Otherwise if we wait for
00689          * the full timeout we can also be sure all RDMA has stopped. */
00690         conn->gnc_last_rx = conn->gnc_last_rx_cq = jiffies;
00691         mb();
00692 
00693         /* schedule sending CLOSE - if we are in quiesce, this adds to
00694          * gnd_ready_conns and allows us to find it in quiesce processing */
00695         kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
00696 
00697         EXIT;
00698 }
00699 
00700 void
00701 kgnilnd_close_conn(kgn_conn_t *conn, int error)
00702 {
00703         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00704         /* need to check the state here - this call is racy and we don't
00705          * know the state until after the lock is grabbed */
00706         if (conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED) {
00707                 kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, error);
00708         }
00709         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00710 }
00711 
00712 void
00713 kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn(kgn_conn_t *conn)
00714 {
00715         LIST_HEAD               (sinners);
00716         kgn_tx_t               *tx, *txn;
00717         int                     nlive = 0;
00718         int                     nrdma = 0;
00719         int                     nq_rdma = 0;
00720         int                     logmsg;
00721         ENTRY;
00722 
00723         /* Dump log  on cksum error - wait until complete phase to let
00724          * RX of error happen */
00725         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_checksum_dump &&
00726             (conn != NULL && conn->gnc_peer_error == -ENOKEY)) {
00727                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00728         }
00729 
00730         /* _CLOSED set in kgnilnd_process_fmaq once we decide to
00731          * send the CLOSE or not */
00732         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_CLOSED,
00733                  "conn 0x%p->%s with bad state %s\n",
00734                  conn, conn->gnc_peer ?
00735                         libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid) :
00736                         "<?>",
00737                  kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
00738 
00739         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->gnc_hashlist));
00740 
00741         /* we've sent the close, start nuking */
00742         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SCHEDULE_COMPLETE))
00743                 kgnilnd_schedule_conn(conn);
00744 
00745         if (conn->gnc_scheduled != GNILND_CONN_PROCESS) {
00746                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "Error someone scheduled us after we were "
00747                                 "done, Attempting to recover conn 0x%p "
00748                                 "scheduled %d function: %s line: %d\n", conn,
00749                                 conn->gnc_scheduled, conn->gnc_sched_caller,
00750                                 conn->gnc_sched_line);
00751                 RETURN_EXIT;
00752         }
00753 
00754         /* we don't use lists to track things that we can get out of the
00755          * tx_ref table... */
00756 
00757         /* need to hold locks for tx_list_state, sampling it is too racy:
00758          * - the lock actually protects tx != NULL, but we can't take the proper
00759          *   lock until we check tx_list_state, which would be too late and
00760          *   we could have the TX change under us.
00761          * gnd_rdmaq_lock and gnd_lock and not used together, so taking both
00762          * should be fine */
00763         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
00764         spin_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
00765 
00766         for (nrdma = 0; nrdma < GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID; nrdma++) {
00767                 tx = conn->gnc_tx_ref_table[nrdma];
00768 
00769                 if (tx != NULL) {
00770                         /* only print the first error and if not CLOSE, we often don't see
00771                          * CQ events for that by the time we get here... and really don't care */
00772                         if (nlive || tx->tx_msg.gnm_type == GNILND_MSG_CLOSE)
00773                                 tx->tx_state |= GNILND_TX_QUIET_ERROR;
00774                         nlive++;
00775                         GNIDBG_TX(D_NET, tx, "cleaning up on close, nlive %d", nlive);
00776 
00777                         /* don't worry about gnc_lock here as nobody else should be
00778                          * touching this conn */
00779                         kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, NULL, conn, GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
00780                         list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, &sinners);
00781                 }
00782         }
00783         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_lock);
00784         spin_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
00785 
00786         /* nobody should have marked this as needing scheduling after
00787          * we called close - so only ref should be us handling it */
00788         if (conn->gnc_scheduled != GNILND_CONN_PROCESS) {
00789                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "Error someone scheduled us after we were "
00790                                 "done, Attempting to recover conn 0x%p "
00791                                 "scheduled %d function %s line: %d\n", conn,
00792                                 conn->gnc_scheduled, conn->gnc_sched_caller,
00793                                 conn->gnc_sched_line);
00794         }
00795         /* now reset a few to actual counters... */
00796         nrdma = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_rdma);
00797         nq_rdma = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nq_rdma);
00798 
00799         if (!list_empty(&sinners)) {
00800                 list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, txn, &sinners, tx_list) {
00801                         /* clear tx_list to make tx_add_list_locked happy */
00802                         list_del_init(&tx->tx_list);
00803                         /* The error codes determine if we hold onto the MDD */
00804                         kgnilnd_tx_done(tx, conn->gnc_error);
00805                 }
00806         }
00807 
00808         logmsg = (nlive + nrdma + nq_rdma);
00809 
00810         if (logmsg) {
00811                 if (conn->gnc_peer->gnp_down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP) {
00812                         CNETERR("Closed conn 0x%p->%s (errno %d, peer errno %d): "
00813                                 "canceled %d TX, %d/%d RDMA\n",
00814                                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
00815                                 conn->gnc_error, conn->gnc_peer_error,
00816                                 nlive, nq_rdma, nrdma);
00817                 } else {
00818                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Closed conn 0x%p->%s (errno %d,"
00819                                 " peer errno %d): canceled %d TX, %d/%d RDMA\n",
00820                                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
00821                                 conn->gnc_error, conn->gnc_peer_error,
00822                                 nlive, nq_rdma, nrdma);
00823                 }
00824         }
00825 
00826         kgnilnd_destroy_conn_ep(conn);
00827 
00828         /* Bug 765042 - race this with completing a new conn to same peer - we need
00829          * finish_connect to detach purgatory before we can do it ourselves here */
00830         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FINISH_PURG);
00831 
00832         /* now it is safe to remove from peer list - anyone looking at
00833          * gnp_conns now is free to unlink if not on purgatory */
00834         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00835 
00836         conn->gnc_state = GNILND_CONN_DONE;
00837 
00838         /* Decrement counter if we are marked by del_conn_or_peers for closing
00839          */
00840         if (conn->gnc_needs_closing)
00841                 kgnilnd_admin_decref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_conns);
00842 
00843         /* Remove from peer's list of valid connections if its not in purgatory */
00844         if (!conn->gnc_in_purgatory) {
00845                 list_del_init(&conn->gnc_list);
00846                 /* Lose peers reference on the conn */
00847                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
00848         }
00849 
00850         /* NB - only unlinking if we set pending in del_peer_locked from admin or
00851          * shutdown */
00852         if (kgnilnd_peer_active(conn->gnc_peer) &&
00853             conn->gnc_peer->gnp_pending_unlink &&
00854             kgnilnd_can_unlink_peer_locked(conn->gnc_peer)) {
00855                 kgnilnd_unlink_peer_locked(conn->gnc_peer);
00856         }
00857 
00858         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
00859 
00860         /* I'm telling Mommy! - use peer_error if they initiated close */
00861         kgnilnd_peer_notify(conn->gnc_peer,
00862                             conn->gnc_error == -ECONNRESET ?
00863                             conn->gnc_peer_error : conn->gnc_error, 0);
00864 
00865         EXIT;
00866 }
00867 
00868 int
00869 kgnilnd_set_conn_params(kgn_dgram_t *dgram)
00870 {
00871         kgn_conn_t             *conn = dgram->gndg_conn;
00872         kgn_connreq_t          *connreq = &dgram->gndg_conn_in;
00873         kgn_gniparams_t        *rem_param = &connreq->gncr_gnparams;
00874         gni_return_t            rrc;
00875         int                     rc = 0;
00876         gni_smsg_attr_t        *remote = &connreq->gncr_gnparams.gnpr_smsg_attr;
00877 
00878         /* set timeout vals in conn early so we can use them for the NAK */
00879 
00880         /* use max of the requested and our timeout, peer will do the same */
00881         conn->gnc_timeout = MAX(conn->gnc_timeout, connreq->gncr_timeout);
00882 
00883         /* only ep_bind really mucks around with the CQ */
00884         /* only ep bind if we are not connecting to ourself and the dstnid is not a wildcard. this check
00885          * is necessary as you can only bind an ep once and we must make sure we dont bind when already bound.
00886          */
00887         if (connreq->gncr_dstnid != LNET_NID_ANY && dgram->gndg_conn_out.gncr_dstnid != connreq->gncr_srcnid) {
00888                 mutex_lock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
00889                 rrc = kgnilnd_ep_bind(conn->gnc_ephandle,
00890                         connreq->gncr_gnparams.gnpr_host_id,
00891                         conn->gnc_cqid);
00892                 mutex_unlock(&conn->gnc_device->gnd_cq_mutex);
00893                 if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
00894                         rc = -ECONNABORTED;
00895                         goto return_out;
00896                 }
00897         }
00898 
00899         rrc = kgnilnd_ep_set_eventdata(conn->gnc_ephandle, conn->gnc_cqid,
00900                          connreq->gncr_gnparams.gnpr_cqid);
00901         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
00902                 rc = -ECONNABORTED;
00903                 goto cleanup_out;
00904         }
00905 
00906         /* Initialize SMSG */
00907         rrc = kgnilnd_smsg_init(conn->gnc_ephandle, &conn->gnpr_smsg_attr,
00908                         &connreq->gncr_gnparams.gnpr_smsg_attr);
00909         if (unlikely(rrc == GNI_RC_INVALID_PARAM)) {
00910                 gni_smsg_attr_t *local = &conn->gnpr_smsg_attr;
00911                 /* help folks figure out if there is a tunable off, etc. */
00912                 LCONSOLE_ERROR("SMSG attribute mismatch. Data from local/remote:"
00913                                " type %d/%d msg_maxsize %u/%u"
00914                                " mbox_maxcredit %u/%u. Please check kgni"
00915                                " logs for further data\n",
00916                                local->msg_type, remote->msg_type,
00917                                local->msg_maxsize, remote->msg_maxsize,
00918                                local->mbox_maxcredit, remote->mbox_maxcredit);
00919         }
00920         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
00921                 rc = -ECONNABORTED;
00922                 goto cleanup_out;
00923         }
00924 
00925         /* log this for help in debuggin SMSG buffer re-use */
00926         CDEBUG(D_NET, "conn %p src %s dst %s smsg %p acquired"
00927                 " local cqid %u SMSG %p->%u hndl "LPX64"."LPX64
00928                 " remote cqid %u SMSG %p->%u hndl "LPX64"."LPX64"\n",
00929                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(connreq->gncr_srcnid),
00930                 libcfs_nid2str(connreq->gncr_dstnid),
00931                 &conn->gnpr_smsg_attr,
00932                 conn->gnc_cqid,
00933                 conn->gnpr_smsg_attr.msg_buffer,
00934                 conn->gnpr_smsg_attr.mbox_offset,
00935                 conn->gnpr_smsg_attr.mem_hndl.qword1,
00936                 conn->gnpr_smsg_attr.mem_hndl.qword2,
00937                 rem_param->gnpr_cqid,
00938                 rem_param->gnpr_smsg_attr.msg_buffer,
00939                 rem_param->gnpr_smsg_attr.mbox_offset,
00940                 rem_param->gnpr_smsg_attr.mem_hndl.qword1,
00941                 rem_param->gnpr_smsg_attr.mem_hndl.qword2);
00942 
00943         conn->gnc_peerstamp = connreq->gncr_peerstamp;
00944         conn->gnc_peer_connstamp = connreq->gncr_connstamp;
00945         conn->remote_mbox_addr = (void *)((char *)remote->msg_buffer + remote->mbox_offset);
00946 
00947         /* We update the reaper timeout once we have a valid conn and timeout */
00948         kgnilnd_update_reaper_timeout(GNILND_TO2KA(conn->gnc_timeout));
00949 
00950         return 0;
00951 
00952 cleanup_out:
00953         rrc = kgnilnd_ep_unbind(conn->gnc_ephandle);
00954         /* not sure I can just let this fly */
00955         LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
00956                 "bad rc from gni_ep_unbind trying to cleanup: %d\n", rrc);
00957 
00958 return_out:
00959         LASSERTF(rc != 0, "SOFTWARE BUG: rc == 0\n");
00960         CERROR("Error setting connection params from %s: %d\n",
00961                libcfs_nid2str(connreq->gncr_srcnid), rc);
00962         return rc;
00963 }
00964 
00965 /* needs down_read on kgn_net_rw_sem held from before this call until
00966  * after the write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock - this ensures we stay sane
00967  * with kgnilnd_shutdown - it'll get the sem and set shutdown, then get the
00968  * kgn_peer_conn_lock to start del_peer'ing. If we hold the sem until after
00969  * kgn_peer_conn_lock is held, we guarantee that nobody calls
00970  * kgnilnd_add_peer_locked without checking gnn_shutdown */
00971 int
00972 kgnilnd_create_peer_safe(kgn_peer_t **peerp,
00973                          lnet_nid_t nid,
00974                          kgn_net_t *net,
00975                          int node_state)
00976 {
00977         kgn_peer_t      *peer;
00978         int             rc;
00979 
00980         LASSERT(nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
00981 
00982         /* We dont pass the net around in the dgram anymore so here is where we find it
00983          * this will work unless its in shutdown or the nid has a net that is invalid.
00984          * Either way error code needs to be returned in that case.
00985          *
00986          * If the net passed in is not NULL then we can use it, this alleviates looking it
00987          * when the calling function has access to the data.
00988          */
00989         if (net == NULL) {
00990                 rc = kgnilnd_find_net(nid, &net);
00991                 if (rc < 0)
00992                         return rc;
00993         } else {
00994                 /* find net adds a reference on the net if we are not using
00995                  * it we must do it manually so the net references are
00996                  * correct when tearing down the net
00997                  */
00998                 kgnilnd_net_addref(net);
00999         }
01000 
01001         LIBCFS_ALLOC(peer, sizeof(*peer));
01002         if (peer == NULL) {
01003                 kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
01004                 return -ENOMEM;
01005         }
01006         peer->gnp_nid = nid;
01007         peer->gnp_down = node_state;
01008 
01009         /* translate from nid to nic addr & store */
01010         rc = kgnilnd_nid_to_nicaddrs(LNET_NIDADDR(nid), 1, &peer->gnp_host_id);
01011         if (rc <= 0) {
01012                 kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
01013                 LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
01014                 return -ESRCH;
01015         }
01016         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer 0x%p->%s -> NIC 0x%x\n", peer,
01017                 libcfs_nid2str(nid), peer->gnp_host_id);
01018 
01019         atomic_set(&peer->gnp_refcount, 1);     /* 1 ref for caller */
01020         atomic_set(&peer->gnp_dirty_eps, 0);
01021 
01022         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->gnp_list);
01023         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->gnp_connd_list);
01024         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->gnp_conns);
01025         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->gnp_tx_queue);
01026 
01027         /* the first reconnect should happen immediately, so we leave
01028          * gnp_reconnect_interval set to 0 */
01029 
01030         LASSERTF(net != NULL, "peer 0x%p->%s with NULL net\n",
01031                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(nid));
01032 
01033         /* must have kgn_net_rw_sem held for this...  */
01034         if (net->gnn_shutdown) {
01035                 /* shutdown has started already */
01036                 kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
01037                 LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
01038                 return -ESHUTDOWN;
01039         }
01040 
01041         peer->gnp_net = net;
01042 
01043         atomic_inc(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers);
01044 
01045         *peerp = peer;
01046         return 0;
01047 }
01048 
01049 void
01050 kgnilnd_destroy_peer(kgn_peer_t *peer)
01051 {
01052         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer %s %p deleted\n",
01053                libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer);
01054         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&peer->gnp_refcount) == 0,
01055                  "peer 0x%p->%s refs %d\n",
01056                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
01057                  atomic_read(&peer->gnp_refcount));
01058         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&peer->gnp_dirty_eps) == 0,
01059                  "peer 0x%p->%s dirty eps %d\n",
01060                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
01061                  atomic_read(&peer->gnp_dirty_eps));
01062         LASSERTF(peer->gnp_net != NULL, "peer %p (%s) with NULL net\n",
01063                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01064         LASSERTF(!kgnilnd_peer_active(peer),
01065                  "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01066                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01067         LASSERTF(peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_IDLE || peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_KILL,
01068                  "peer 0x%p->%s, connecting %d\n",
01069                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer->gnp_connecting);
01070         LASSERTF(list_empty(&peer->gnp_conns),
01071                  "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01072                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01073         LASSERTF(list_empty(&peer->gnp_tx_queue),
01074                  "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01075                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01076         LASSERTF(list_empty(&peer->gnp_connd_list),
01077                  "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01078                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01079 
01080         /* NB a peer's connections keep a reference on their peer until
01081          * they are destroyed, so we can be assured that _all_ state to do
01082          * with this peer has been cleaned up when its refcount drops to
01083          * zero. */
01084 
01085         atomic_dec(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers);
01086         kgnilnd_net_decref(peer->gnp_net);
01087 
01088         LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
01089 }
01090 
01091 /* the conn might not have made it all the way through to a connected
01092  * state - but we need to purgatory any conn that a remote peer might
01093  * have seen through a posted dgram as well */
01094 void
01095 kgnilnd_add_purgatory_locked(kgn_conn_t *conn, kgn_peer_t *peer)
01096 {
01097         kgn_mbox_info_t *mbox = NULL;
01098         ENTRY;
01099 
01100         /* NB - the caller should own conn by removing him from the
01101          * scheduler thread when finishing the close */
01102 
01103         LASSERTF(peer != NULL, "conn %p with NULL peer\n", conn);
01104 
01105         /* If this is still true, need to add the calls to unlink back in and
01106          * figure out how to close the hole on loopback conns */
01107         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_peer_active(peer), "can't use inactive peer %s (%p)"
01108                 " we'll never recover the resources\n",
01109                 libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer);
01110 
01111         CDEBUG(D_NET, "conn %p peer %p dev %p\n", conn, peer,
01112                 conn->gnc_device);
01113 
01114         LASSERTF(conn->gnc_in_purgatory == 0,
01115                 "Conn already in purgatory\n");
01116         conn->gnc_in_purgatory = 1;
01117 
01118         mbox = &conn->gnc_fma_blk->gnm_mbox_info[conn->gnc_mbox_id];
01119         mbox->mbx_prev_purg_nid = peer->gnp_nid;
01120         mbox->mbx_add_purgatory = jiffies;
01121         kgnilnd_release_mbox(conn, 1);
01122 
01123         LASSERTF(list_empty(&conn->gnc_mdd_list),
01124                 "conn 0x%p->%s with active purgatory hold MDD %d\n",
01125                 conn, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid),
01126                 kgnilnd_count_list(&conn->gnc_mdd_list));
01127 
01128         EXIT;
01129 }
01130 
01131 /* Instead of detaching everything from purgatory here we just mark the conn as needing
01132  * detach, when the reaper checks the conn the next time it will detach it.
01133  * Calling function requires write_lock held on kgn_peer_conn_lock
01134  */
01135 void
01136 kgnilnd_mark_for_detach_purgatory_all_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer) {
01137         kgn_conn_t       *conn;
01138 
01139         list_for_each_entry(conn, &peer->gnp_conns, gnc_list) {
01140                 if (conn->gnc_in_purgatory && !conn->gnc_needs_detach) {
01141                         conn->gnc_needs_detach = 1;
01142                         kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_detach);
01143                 }
01144         }
01145 }
01146 
01147 /* Calling function needs a write_lock held on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
01148 void
01149 kgnilnd_detach_purgatory_locked(kgn_conn_t *conn, struct list_head *conn_list)
01150 {
01151         kgn_mbox_info_t *mbox = NULL;
01152 
01153         /* if needed, add the conn purgatory data to the list passed in */
01154         if (conn->gnc_in_purgatory) {
01155                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer %p->%s purg_conn %p@%s mdd_list #tx %d\n",
01156                         conn->gnc_peer, libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01157                         conn, kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn),
01158                         kgnilnd_count_list(&conn->gnc_mdd_list));
01159 
01160                 mbox = &conn->gnc_fma_blk->gnm_mbox_info[conn->gnc_mbox_id];
01161                 mbox->mbx_detach_of_purgatory = jiffies;
01162 
01163                 /* conn->gnc_list is the entry point on peer->gnp_conns, so detaching it
01164                  * here removes it from the list of 'valid' peer connections.
01165                  * We put the current conn onto a list of conns to call kgnilnd_release_purgatory_locked()
01166                  * and as such the caller of kgnilnd_detach_purgatory_locked() now owns that conn, since its not
01167                  * on the peer's conn_list anymore.
01168                  */
01169 
01170                 list_del_init(&conn->gnc_list);
01171 
01172                 /* NB - only unlinking if we set pending in del_peer_locked from admin or
01173                  * shutdown */
01174                 if (kgnilnd_peer_active(conn->gnc_peer) &&
01175                     conn->gnc_peer->gnp_pending_unlink &&
01176                     kgnilnd_can_unlink_peer_locked(conn->gnc_peer)) {
01177                         kgnilnd_unlink_peer_locked(conn->gnc_peer);
01178                 }
01179                 /* The reaper will not call detach unless the conn is fully through kgnilnd_complete_closed_conn.
01180                  * If the conn is not in a DONE state somehow we are attempting to detach even though
01181                  * the conn has not been fully cleaned up. If we detach while the conn is still closing
01182                  * we will end up with an orphaned connection that has valid ep_handle, that is not on a
01183                  * peer.
01184                  */
01185 
01186                 LASSERTF(conn->gnc_state == GNILND_CONN_DONE, "Conn in invalid state  %p@%s \n",
01187                                 conn, kgnilnd_conn_state2str(conn));
01188 
01189                 /* move from peer to the delayed release list */
01190                 list_add_tail(&conn->gnc_list, conn_list);
01191         }
01192 }
01193 
01194 void
01195 kgnilnd_release_purgatory_list(struct list_head *conn_list)
01196 {
01197         kgn_device_t            *dev;
01198         kgn_conn_t              *conn, *connN;
01199         kgn_mdd_purgatory_t     *gmp, *gmpN;
01200 
01201         list_for_each_entry_safe(conn, connN, conn_list, gnc_list) {
01202                 dev = conn->gnc_device;
01203 
01204                 kgnilnd_release_mbox(conn, -1);
01205                 conn->gnc_in_purgatory = 0;
01206 
01207                 list_del_init(&conn->gnc_list);
01208 
01209                 /* gnc_needs_detach is set in kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer. It is used to keep track
01210                  * of conns that have been marked for detach by kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer.
01211                  * The function uses kgn_npending_detach to verify the conn has
01212                  * actually been detached.
01213                  */
01214 
01215                 if (conn->gnc_needs_detach)
01216                         kgnilnd_admin_decref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_detach);
01217 
01218                 /* if this guy is really dead (we are doing release from reaper),
01219                  * make sure we tell LNet - if this is from other context,
01220                  * the checks in the function will prevent an errant
01221                  * notification */
01222                 kgnilnd_peer_notify(conn->gnc_peer, conn->gnc_error, 0);
01223 
01224                 list_for_each_entry_safe(gmp, gmpN, &conn->gnc_mdd_list,
01225                                          gmp_list) {
01226                         CDEBUG(D_NET,
01227                                "dev %p releasing held mdd "LPX64"."LPX64"\n",
01228                                conn->gnc_device, gmp->gmp_map_key.qword1,
01229                                gmp->gmp_map_key.qword2);
01230 
01231                         atomic_dec(&dev->gnd_n_mdd_held);
01232                         kgnilnd_mem_mdd_release(conn->gnc_device->gnd_handle,
01233                                                 &gmp->gmp_map_key);
01234                         /* ignoring the return code - if kgni/ghal can't find it
01235                          * it must be released already */
01236 
01237                         list_del_init(&gmp->gmp_list);
01238                         LIBCFS_FREE(gmp, sizeof(*gmp));
01239                 }
01240                 /* lose conn ref for purgatory */
01241                 kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
01242         }
01243 }
01244 
01245 /* needs write_lock on kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
01246 void
01247 kgnilnd_peer_increase_reconnect_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer)
01248 {
01249         int current_to;
01250 
01251         current_to = peer->gnp_reconnect_interval;
01252 
01253         /* we'll try to reconnect fast the first time, then back-off */
01254         if (current_to == 0) {
01255                 peer->gnp_reconnect_time = jiffies - 1;
01256                 current_to = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_min_reconnect_interval;
01257         } else {
01258                 peer->gnp_reconnect_time = jiffies + cfs_time_seconds(current_to);
01259                 /* add 50% of min timeout & retry */
01260                 current_to += *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_min_reconnect_interval / 2;
01261         }
01262 
01263         current_to = MIN(current_to,
01264                                 *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_max_reconnect_interval);
01265 
01266         peer->gnp_reconnect_interval = current_to;
01267         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer %s can reconnect at %lu interval %lu\n",
01268                libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer->gnp_reconnect_time,
01269                peer->gnp_reconnect_interval);
01270 }
01271 
01272 /* needs kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
01273 kgn_peer_t *
01274 kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(lnet_nid_t nid)
01275 {
01276         struct list_head *peer_list = kgnilnd_nid2peerlist(nid);
01277         kgn_peer_t       *peer;
01278 
01279         /* Chopping nid down to only NIDADDR using LNET_NIDADDR so we only
01280          * have a single peer per device instead of a peer per nid/net combo.
01281          */
01282 
01283         list_for_each_entry(peer, peer_list, gnp_list) {
01284                 if (LNET_NIDADDR(nid) != LNET_NIDADDR(peer->gnp_nid))
01285                         continue;
01286 
01287                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "got peer [%p] -> %s c %d (%d)\n",
01288                        peer, libcfs_nid2str(nid),
01289                        peer->gnp_connecting,
01290                        atomic_read(&peer->gnp_refcount));
01291                 return peer;
01292         }
01293         return NULL;
01294 }
01295 
01296 /* need write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
01297 void
01298 kgnilnd_unlink_peer_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer)
01299 {
01300         LASSERTF(list_empty(&peer->gnp_conns),
01301                 "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01302                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01303         LASSERTF(list_empty(&peer->gnp_tx_queue),
01304                 "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01305                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01306         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_peer_active(peer),
01307                 "peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01308                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01309         CDEBUG(D_NET, "unlinking peer 0x%p->%s\n",
01310                 peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01311 
01312         list_del_init(&peer->gnp_list);
01313         kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_version++;
01314         kgnilnd_admin_decref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_unlink);
01315         /* lose peerlist's ref */
01316         kgnilnd_peer_decref(peer);
01317 }
01318 
01319 int
01320 kgnilnd_get_peer_info(int index,
01321                       kgn_peer_t **found_peer,
01322                       lnet_nid_t *id, __u32 *nic_addr,
01323                       int *refcount, int *connecting)
01324 {
01325         struct list_head  *ptmp;
01326         kgn_peer_t        *peer;
01327         int               i;
01328         int               rc = -ENOENT;
01329 
01330         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01331 
01332         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
01333 
01334                 list_for_each(ptmp, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i]) {
01335                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kgn_peer_t, gnp_list);
01336 
01337                         if (index-- > 0)
01338                                 continue;
01339 
01340                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "found peer %p (%s) at index %d\n",
01341                                peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), index);
01342 
01343                         *found_peer  = peer;
01344                         *id          = peer->gnp_nid;
01345                         *nic_addr    = peer->gnp_host_id;
01346                         *refcount    = atomic_read(&peer->gnp_refcount);
01347                         *connecting  = peer->gnp_connecting;
01348 
01349                         rc = 0;
01350                         goto out;
01351                 }
01352         }
01353 out:
01354         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01355         if (rc)
01356                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "no gni peer at index %d\n", index);
01357         return rc;
01358 }
01359 
01360 /* requires write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock held */
01361 void
01362 kgnilnd_add_peer_locked(lnet_nid_t nid, kgn_peer_t *new_stub_peer, kgn_peer_t **peerp)
01363 {
01364         kgn_peer_t        *peer, *peer2;
01365 
01366         LASSERTF(new_stub_peer != NULL, "bad stub peer for nid %s\n",
01367                  libcfs_nid2str(nid));
01368 
01369         peer2 = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01370         if (peer2 != NULL) {
01371                 /* A peer was created during the lock transition, so drop
01372                  * the new one we created */
01373                 kgnilnd_peer_decref(new_stub_peer);
01374                 peer = peer2;
01375         } else {
01376                 peer = new_stub_peer;
01377                 /* peer table takes existing ref on peer */
01378 
01379                 LASSERTF(!kgnilnd_peer_active(peer),
01380                         "peer 0x%p->%s already in peer table\n",
01381                         peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01382                 list_add_tail(&peer->gnp_list,
01383                               kgnilnd_nid2peerlist(nid));
01384                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_version++;
01385         }
01386 
01387         LASSERTF(peer->gnp_net != NULL, "peer 0x%p->%s with NULL net\n",
01388                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01389         *peerp = peer;
01390 }
01391 
01392 int
01393 kgnilnd_add_peer(kgn_net_t *net, lnet_nid_t nid, kgn_peer_t **peerp)
01394 {
01395         kgn_peer_t        *peer;
01396         int                rc;
01397         int                node_state;
01398         ENTRY;
01399 
01400         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY)
01401                 return -EINVAL;
01402 
01403         node_state = kgnilnd_get_node_state(LNET_NIDADDR(nid));
01404 
01405         /* NB - this will not block during normal operations -
01406          * the only writer of this is in the startup/shutdown path. */
01407         rc = down_read_trylock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01408         if (!rc) {
01409                 rc = -ESHUTDOWN;
01410                 RETURN(rc);
01411         }
01412         rc = kgnilnd_create_peer_safe(&peer, nid, net, node_state);
01413         if (rc != 0) {
01414                 up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01415                 RETURN(rc);
01416         }
01417 
01418         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01419         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01420 
01421         kgnilnd_add_peer_locked(nid, peer, peerp);
01422 
01423         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer 0x%p->%s connecting %d\n",
01424                peerp, libcfs_nid2str((*peerp)->gnp_nid),
01425                (*peerp)->gnp_connecting);
01426 
01427         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01428         RETURN(0);
01429 }
01430 
01431 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
01432 void
01433 kgnilnd_cancel_peer_connect_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, struct list_head *zombies)
01434 {
01435         kgn_tx_t        *tx, *txn;
01436 
01437         /* we do care about state of gnp_connecting - we could be between
01438          * reconnect attempts, so try to find the dgram and cancel the TX
01439          * anyways. If we are in the process of posting DONT do anything;
01440          * once it fails or succeeds we can nuke the connect attempt.
01441          * We have no idea where in kgnilnd_post_dgram we are so we cant
01442          * attempt to cancel until the function is done.
01443          */
01444 
01445         /* make sure peer isn't in process of connecting or waiting for connect*/
01446         spin_lock(&peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev->gnd_connd_lock);
01447         if (!(list_empty(&peer->gnp_connd_list))) {
01448                 list_del_init(&peer->gnp_connd_list);
01449                 /* remove connd ref */
01450                 kgnilnd_peer_decref(peer);
01451         }
01452         spin_unlock(&peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev->gnd_connd_lock);
01453 
01454         if (peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_POSTING || peer->gnp_connecting == GNILND_PEER_NEEDS_DEATH) {
01455                 peer->gnp_connecting = GNILND_PEER_NEEDS_DEATH;
01456                 /* We are in process of posting right now the xchg set it up for us to
01457                  * cancel the connect so we are finished for now */
01458         } else {
01459                 /* no need for exchange we have the peer lock and its ready for us to nuke */
01460                 LASSERTF(peer->gnp_connecting != GNILND_PEER_POSTING,
01461                         "Peer in invalid state 0x%p->%s, connecting %d\n",
01462                         peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid), peer->gnp_connecting);
01463                 peer->gnp_connecting = GNILND_PEER_IDLE;
01464                 set_mb(peer->gnp_last_dgram_errno, -ETIMEDOUT);
01465                 kgnilnd_find_and_cancel_dgram(peer->gnp_net->gnn_dev,
01466                                                       peer->gnp_nid);
01467         }
01468 
01469         /* The least we can do is nuke the tx's no matter what.... */
01470         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, txn, &peer->gnp_tx_queue, tx_list) {
01471                 kgnilnd_tx_del_state_locked(tx, peer, NULL,
01472                                            GNILND_TX_ALLOCD);
01473                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, zombies);
01474         }
01475 }
01476 
01477 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
01478 void
01479 kgnilnd_del_peer_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, int error)
01480 {
01481         /* this peer could be passive and only held for purgatory,
01482          * take a ref to ensure it doesn't disappear in this function */
01483         kgnilnd_peer_addref(peer);
01484 
01485         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_FIND_TARGET);
01486 
01487         /* if purgatory release cleared it out, don't try again */
01488         if (kgnilnd_peer_active(peer)) {
01489                 /* always do this to allow kgnilnd_start_connect and
01490                  * kgnilnd_finish_connect to catch this before they
01491                  * wrap up their operations */
01492                 if (kgnilnd_can_unlink_peer_locked(peer)) {
01493                         /* already released purgatory, so only active
01494                          * conns hold it */
01495                         kgnilnd_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
01496                 } else {
01497                         kgnilnd_close_peer_conns_locked(peer, error);
01498                         /* peer unlinks itself when last conn is closed */
01499                 }
01500         }
01501 
01502         /* we are done, release back to the wild */
01503         kgnilnd_peer_decref(peer);
01504 }
01505 
01506 int
01507 kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(kgn_net_t *net, lnet_nid_t nid, int command,
01508                           int error)
01509 {
01510         LIST_HEAD               (souls);
01511         LIST_HEAD               (zombies);
01512         struct list_head        *ptmp, *pnxt;
01513         kgn_peer_t              *peer;
01514         int                     lo;
01515         int                     hi;
01516         int                     i;
01517         int                     rc = -ENOENT;
01518 
01519         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01520 
01521         if (nid != LNET_NID_ANY)
01522                 lo = hi = kgnilnd_nid2peerlist(nid) - kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers;
01523         else {
01524                 lo = 0;
01525                 hi = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size - 1;
01526                 /* wildcards always succeed */
01527                 rc = 0;
01528         }
01529 
01530         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i++) {
01531                 list_for_each_safe(ptmp, pnxt, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i]) {
01532                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kgn_peer_t, gnp_list);
01533 
01534                         LASSERTF(peer->gnp_net != NULL,
01535                                 "peer %p (%s) with NULL net\n",
01536                                  peer, libcfs_nid2str(peer->gnp_nid));
01537 
01538                         if (net != NULL && peer->gnp_net != net)
01539                                 continue;
01540 
01541                         if (!(nid == LNET_NID_ANY || LNET_NIDADDR(peer->gnp_nid) == LNET_NIDADDR(nid)))
01542                                 continue;
01543 
01544                         /* In both cases, we want to stop any in-flight
01545                          * connect attempts */
01546                         kgnilnd_cancel_peer_connect_locked(peer, &zombies);
01547 
01548                         switch (command) {
01549                         case GNILND_DEL_CONN:
01550                                 kgnilnd_close_peer_conns_locked(peer, error);
01551                                 break;
01552                         case GNILND_DEL_PEER:
01553                                 peer->gnp_pending_unlink = 1;
01554                                 kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_unlink);
01555                                 kgnilnd_mark_for_detach_purgatory_all_locked(peer);
01556                                 kgnilnd_del_peer_locked(peer, error);
01557                                 break;
01558                         case GNILND_CLEAR_PURGATORY:
01559                                 /* Mark everything ready for detach reaper will cleanup
01560                                  * once we release the kgn_peer_conn_lock
01561                                  */
01562                                 kgnilnd_mark_for_detach_purgatory_all_locked(peer);
01563                                 peer->gnp_last_errno = -EISCONN;
01564                                 /* clear reconnect so he can reconnect soon */
01565                                 peer->gnp_reconnect_time = 0;
01566                                 peer->gnp_reconnect_interval = 0;
01567                                 break;
01568                         default:
01569                                 CERROR("bad command %d\n", command);
01570                                 LBUG();
01571                         }
01572                         /* we matched something */
01573                         rc = 0;
01574                 }
01575         }
01576 
01577         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01578 
01579         /* nuke peer TX */
01580         kgnilnd_txlist_done(&zombies, error);
01581 
01582         /* This function does not return until the commands it initiated have completed,
01583          * since they have to work there way through the other threads. In the case of shutdown
01584          * threads are not woken up until after this call is initiated so we cannot wait, we just
01585          * need to return. The same applies for stack reset we shouldnt wait as the reset thread
01586          * handles closing.
01587          */
01588 
01589         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_RACE_RESET);
01590 
01591         if (error == -ENOTRECOVERABLE || error == -ESHUTDOWN) {
01592                 return rc;
01593         }
01594 
01595         i = 4;
01596         while (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_conns)   ||
01597                atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_detach)  ||
01598                atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_unlink)) {
01599 
01600                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
01601                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
01602                 i++;
01603 
01604                 CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET, "Waiting on %d peers %d closes %d detaches\n",
01605                                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_unlink),
01606                                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_conns),
01607                                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_detach));
01608         }
01609 
01610         return rc;
01611 }
01612 
01613 kgn_conn_t *
01614 kgnilnd_get_conn_by_idx(int index)
01615 {
01616         kgn_peer_t        *peer;
01617         struct list_head  *ptmp;
01618         kgn_conn_t        *conn;
01619         struct list_head  *ctmp;
01620         int                i;
01621 
01622 
01623         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
01624                 read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01625                 list_for_each(ptmp, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i]) {
01626 
01627                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, kgn_peer_t, gnp_list);
01628 
01629                         list_for_each(ctmp, &peer->gnp_conns) {
01630                                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kgn_conn_t, gnc_list);
01631 
01632                                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
01633                                         continue;
01634 
01635                                 if (index-- > 0)
01636                                         continue;
01637 
01638                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "++conn[%p] -> %s (%d)\n", conn,
01639                                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid),
01640                                        atomic_read(&conn->gnc_refcount));
01641                                 kgnilnd_conn_addref(conn);
01642                                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01643                                 return conn;
01644                         }
01645                 }
01646                 read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01647         }
01648 
01649         return NULL;
01650 }
01651 
01652 int
01653 kgnilnd_get_conn_info(kgn_peer_t *peer,
01654                       int *device_id, __u64 *peerstamp,
01655                       int *tx_seq, int *rx_seq,
01656                       int *fmaq_len, int *nfma, int *nrdma)
01657 {
01658         kgn_conn_t        *conn;
01659         int               rc = 0;
01660 
01661         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01662 
01663         conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
01664         if (conn == NULL) {
01665                 rc = -ENOENT;
01666                 goto out;
01667         }
01668 
01669         *device_id = conn->gnc_device->gnd_host_id;
01670         *peerstamp = conn->gnc_peerstamp;
01671         *tx_seq = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_tx_seq);
01672         *rx_seq = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_rx_seq);
01673         *fmaq_len = kgnilnd_count_list(&conn->gnc_fmaq);
01674         *nfma = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_fma);
01675         *nrdma = atomic_read(&conn->gnc_nlive_rdma);
01676 out:
01677         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01678         return rc;
01679 }
01680 
01681 /* needs write_lock on kgn_peer_conn_lock */
01682 int
01683 kgnilnd_close_peer_conns_locked(kgn_peer_t *peer, int why)
01684 {
01685         kgn_conn_t         *conn;
01686         struct list_head   *ctmp, *cnxt;
01687         int                 count = 0;
01688 
01689         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->gnp_conns) {
01690                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, kgn_conn_t, gnc_list);
01691 
01692                 if (conn->gnc_state != GNILND_CONN_ESTABLISHED)
01693                         continue;
01694 
01695                 count++;
01696                 /* we mark gnc_needs closing and increment kgn_npending_conns so that
01697                  * kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer can wait on the other threads closing
01698                  * and cleaning up the connection.
01699                  */
01700                 if (!conn->gnc_needs_closing) {
01701                         conn->gnc_needs_closing = 1;
01702                         kgnilnd_admin_addref(kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_conns);
01703                 }
01704                 kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, why);
01705         }
01706         return count;
01707 }
01708 
01709 int
01710 kgnilnd_report_node_state(lnet_nid_t nid, int down)
01711 {
01712         int         rc;
01713         kgn_peer_t  *peer, *new_peer;
01714         LIST_HEAD(zombies);
01715 
01716         write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01717         peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01718 
01719         if (peer == NULL) {
01720                 int       i;
01721                 int       found_net = 0;
01722                 kgn_net_t *net;
01723 
01724                 write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01725 
01726                 /* Don't add a peer for node up events */
01727                 if (down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_UP) {
01728                         return 0;
01729                 }
01730 
01731                 /* find any valid net - we don't care which one... */
01732                 down_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01733                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
01734                         list_for_each_entry(net, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i],
01735                                             gnn_list) {
01736                                 found_net = 1;
01737                                 break;
01738                         }
01739 
01740                         if (found_net) {
01741                                 break;
01742                         }
01743                 }
01744                 up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
01745 
01746                 if (!found_net) {
01747                         CNETERR("Could not find a net for nid %lld\n", nid);
01748                         return 1;
01749                 }
01750 
01751                 /* The nid passed in does not yet contain the net portion.
01752                  * Let's build it up now
01753                  */
01754                 nid = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(net->gnn_ni->ni_nid), nid);
01755                 rc = kgnilnd_add_peer(net, nid, &new_peer);
01756 
01757                 if (rc) {
01758                         CNETERR("Could not add peer for nid %lld, rc %d\n",
01759                                 nid, rc);
01760                         return 1;
01761                 }
01762 
01763                 write_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01764                 peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01765 
01766                 if (peer == NULL) {
01767                         CNETERR("Could not find peer for nid %lld\n", nid);
01768                         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01769                         return 1;
01770                 }
01771         }
01772 
01773         peer->gnp_down = down;
01774 
01775         if (down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN) {
01776                 kgn_conn_t *conn;
01777 
01778                 peer->gnp_down_event_time = jiffies;
01779                 kgnilnd_cancel_peer_connect_locked(peer, &zombies);
01780                 conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
01781 
01782                 if (conn != NULL) {
01783                         kgnilnd_close_conn_locked(conn, -ENETRESET);
01784                 }
01785         } else {
01786                 peer->gnp_up_event_time = jiffies;
01787         }
01788 
01789         write_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01790
