01791         if (down == GNILND_RCA_NODE_DOWN) {
01792                 /* using ENETRESET so we don't get messages from
01793                  * kgnilnd_tx_done
01794                  */
01795                 kgnilnd_txlist_done(&zombies, -ENETRESET);
01796                 kgnilnd_peer_notify(peer, -ECONNRESET, 0);
01797                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Received down event for nid %d\n",
01798                               LNET_NIDADDR(nid));
01799         }
01800 
01801         return 0;
01802 }
01803 
01804 int
01805 kgnilnd_ctl(lnet_ni_t *ni, unsigned int cmd, void *arg)
01806 {
01807         struct libcfs_ioctl_data *data = arg;
01808         kgn_net_t                *net = ni->ni_data;
01809         int                       rc = -EINVAL;
01810 
01811         LASSERT(ni == net->gnn_ni);
01812 
01813         switch (cmd) {
01814         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_PEER: {
01815                 lnet_nid_t   nid = 0;
01816                 kgn_peer_t  *peer = NULL;
01817                 __u32 nic_addr = 0;
01818                 __u64 peerstamp = 0;
01819                 int peer_refcount = 0, peer_connecting = 0;
01820                 int device_id = 0;
01821                 int tx_seq = 0, rx_seq = 0;
01822                 int fmaq_len = 0, nfma = 0, nrdma = 0;
01823 
01824                 rc = kgnilnd_get_peer_info(data->ioc_count, &peer,
01825                                            &nid, &nic_addr, &peer_refcount,
01826                                            &peer_connecting);
01827                 if (rc)
01828                         break;
01829 
01830                 /* Barf */
01831                 /* LNET_MKNID is used to mask from lnet the multiplexing/demultiplexing of connections and peers
01832                  * LNET assumes a conn and peer per net, the LNET_MKNID/LNET_NIDADDR allows us to let Lnet see what it
01833                  * wants to see instead of the underlying network that is being used to send the data
01834                  */
01835                 data->ioc_nid    = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid), LNET_NIDADDR(nid));
01836                 data->ioc_flags  = peer_connecting;
01837                 data->ioc_count  = peer_refcount;
01838 
01839                 rc = kgnilnd_get_conn_info(peer, &device_id, &peerstamp,
01840                                            &tx_seq, &rx_seq, &fmaq_len,
01841                                            &nfma, &nrdma);
01842 
01843                 /* This is allowable - a persistent peer could not
01844                  * have a connection */
01845                 if (rc) {
01846                         /* flag to indicate we are not connected -
01847                          * need to print as such */
01848                         data->ioc_flags |= (1<<16);
01849                         rc = 0;
01850                 } else {
01851                         /* still barf */
01852                         data->ioc_net = device_id;
01853                         data->ioc_u64[0] = peerstamp;
01854                         data->ioc_u32[0] = fmaq_len;
01855                         data->ioc_u32[1] = nfma;
01856                         data->ioc_u32[2] = tx_seq;
01857                         data->ioc_u32[3] = rx_seq;
01858                         data->ioc_u32[4] = nrdma;
01859                 }
01860                 break;
01861         }
01862         case IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_PEER: {
01863                 /* just dummy value to allow using common interface */
01864                 kgn_peer_t      *peer;
01865                 rc = kgnilnd_add_peer(net, data->ioc_nid, &peer);
01866                 break;
01867         }
01868         case IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_PEER: {
01869                 /* NULL is passed in so it affects all peers in existence without regard to network
01870                  * as the peer may not exist on the network LNET believes it to be on.
01871                  */
01872                 rc = kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(NULL, data->ioc_nid,
01873                                               GNILND_DEL_PEER, -EUCLEAN);
01874                 break;
01875         }
01876         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_CONN: {
01877                 kgn_conn_t *conn = kgnilnd_get_conn_by_idx(data->ioc_count);
01878 
01879                 if (conn == NULL)
01880                         rc = -ENOENT;
01881                 else {
01882                         rc = 0;
01883                         /* LNET_MKNID is used to build the correct address based on what LNET wants to see instead of
01884                          * the generic connection that is used to send the data
01885                          */
01886                         data->ioc_nid    = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid), LNET_NIDADDR(conn->gnc_peer->gnp_nid));
01887                         data->ioc_u32[0] = conn->gnc_device->gnd_id;
01888                         kgnilnd_conn_decref(conn);
01889                 }
01890                 break;
01891         }
01892         case IOC_LIBCFS_CLOSE_CONNECTION: {
01893                 /* use error = -ENETRESET to indicate it was lctl disconnect */
01894                 /* NULL is passed in so it affects all the nets as the connection is virtual
01895                  * and may not exist on the network LNET believes it to be on.
01896                  */
01897                 rc = kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(NULL, data->ioc_nid,
01898                                               GNILND_DEL_CONN, -ENETRESET);
01899                 break;
01900         }
01901         case IOC_LIBCFS_PUSH_CONNECTION: {
01902                 /* we use this to flush purgatory */
01903                 rc = kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(NULL, data->ioc_nid,
01904                                               GNILND_CLEAR_PURGATORY, -EUCLEAN);
01905                 break;
01906         }
01907         case IOC_LIBCFS_REGISTER_MYNID: {
01908                 /* Ignore if this is a noop */
01909                 if (data->ioc_nid == ni->ni_nid) {
01910                         rc = 0;
01911                 } else {
01912                         CERROR("obsolete IOC_LIBCFS_REGISTER_MYNID: %s(%s)\n",
01913                                libcfs_nid2str(data->ioc_nid),
01914                                libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid));
01915                         rc = -EINVAL;
01916                 }
01917                 break;
01918         }
01919         }
01920 
01921         return rc;
01922 }
01923 
01924 void
01925 kgnilnd_query(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t nid, cfs_time_t *when)
01926 {
01927         kgn_net_t               *net = ni->ni_data;
01928         kgn_tx_t                *tx;
01929         kgn_peer_t              *peer = NULL;
01930         kgn_conn_t              *conn = NULL;
01931         lnet_process_id_t       id = {
01932                 .nid = nid,
01933                 .pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE,
01934         };
01935         ENTRY;
01936 
01937         /* I expect to find him, so only take a read lock */
01938         read_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01939         peer = kgnilnd_find_peer_locked(nid);
01940         if (peer != NULL) {
01941                 /* LIE if in a quiesce - we will update the timeouts after,
01942                  * but we don't want sends failing during it */
01943                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger) {
01944                         *when = jiffies;
01945                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01946                         GOTO(out, 0);
01947                 }
01948 
01949                 /* Update to best guess, might refine on later checks */
01950                 *when = peer->gnp_last_alive;
01951 
01952                 /* we have a peer, how about a conn? */
01953                 conn = kgnilnd_find_conn_locked(peer);
01954 
01955                 if (conn == NULL)  {
01956                         /* if there is no conn, check peer last errno to see if clean disconnect
01957                          * - if it was, we lie to LNet because we believe a TX would complete
01958                          * on reconnect */
01959                         if (kgnilnd_conn_clean_errno(peer->gnp_last_errno)) {
01960                                 *when = jiffies;
01961                         }
01962                         /* we still want to fire a TX and new conn in this case */
01963                 } else {
01964                         /* gnp_last_alive is valid, run for the hills */
01965                         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01966                         GOTO(out, 0);
01967                 }
01968         }
01969         /* if we get here, either we have no peer or no conn for him, so fire off
01970          * new TX to trigger conn setup */
01971         read_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
01972 
01973         /* if we couldn't find him, we'll fire up a TX and get connected -
01974          * if we don't do this, after ni_peer_timeout, LNet will declare him dead.
01975          * So really we treat kgnilnd_query as a bit of a 'connect now' type
01976          * event because it'll only do this when it wants to send
01977          *
01978          * Use a real TX for this to get the proper gnp_tx_queue behavior, etc
01979          * normally we'd use kgnilnd_send_ctlmsg for this, but we don't really
01980          * care that this goes out quickly since we already know we need a new conn
01981          * formed */
01982         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(CFS_FAIL_GNI_NOOP_SEND))
01983                 return;
01984 
01985         tx = kgnilnd_new_tx_msg(GNILND_MSG_NOOP, ni->ni_nid);
01986         if (tx != NULL) {
01987                 kgnilnd_launch_tx(tx, net, &id);
01988         }
01989 out:
01990         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "peer 0x%p->%s when %lu\n", peer,
01991                libcfs_nid2str(nid), *when);
01992         EXIT;
01993 }
01994 
01995 int
01996 kgnilnd_dev_init(kgn_device_t *dev)
01997 {
01998         gni_return_t      rrc;
01999         int               rc = 0;
02000         unsigned int      cq_size;
02001         ENTRY;
02002 
02003         /* size of these CQs should be able to accommodate the outgoing
02004          * RDMA and SMSG transactions.  Since we really don't know what we
02005          * really need here, we'll take credits * 2 * 3 to allow a bunch.
02006          * We need to dig into this more with the performance work. */
02007         cq_size = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_credits * 2 * 3;
02008 
02009         rrc = kgnilnd_cdm_create(dev->gnd_id, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_ptag,
02010                                  *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_pkey, 0,
02011                                  &dev->gnd_domain);
02012         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02013                 CERROR("Can't create CDM %d (%d)\n", dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02014                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02015         }
02016 
02017         rrc = kgnilnd_cdm_attach(dev->gnd_domain, dev->gnd_id,
02018                                  &dev->gnd_host_id, &dev->gnd_handle);
02019         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02020                 CERROR("Can't attach CDM to device %d (%d)\n",
02021                         dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02022                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02023         }
02024 
02025         /* a bit gross, but not much we can do - Aries Sim doesn't have
02026          * hardcoded NIC/NID that we can use */
02027         rc = kgnilnd_setup_nic_translation(dev->gnd_host_id);
02028         if (rc != 0)
02029                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02030 
02031         /* only dev 0 gets the errors - no need to reset the stack twice
02032          * - this works because we have a single PTAG, if we had more
02033          * then we'd need to have multiple handlers */
02034         if (dev->gnd_id == 0) {
02035                 rrc = kgnilnd_subscribe_errors(dev->gnd_handle,
02036                                                 GNI_ERRMASK_CRITICAL |
02037                                                 GNI_ERRMASK_UNKNOWN_TRANSACTION,
02038                                               0, NULL, kgnilnd_critical_error,
02039                                               &dev->gnd_err_handle);
02040                 if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02041                         CERROR("Can't subscribe for errors on device %d: rc %d\n",
02042                                 dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02043                         GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02044                 }
02045 
02046                 rc = kgnilnd_set_quiesce_callback(dev->gnd_handle,
02047                                                   kgnilnd_quiesce_end_callback);
02048                 if (rc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02049                         CERROR("Can't subscribe for quiesce callback on device %d: rc %d\n",
02050                                 dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02051                         GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02052                 }
02053         }
02054 
02055         rrc = sock_create_kern(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_IP, &kgnilnd_data.kgn_sock);
02056         if (rrc < 0) {
02057                 CERROR("sock_create returned %d\n", rrc);
02058                 GOTO(failed, rrc);
02059         }
02060 
02061         rc = kgnilnd_nicaddr_to_nid(dev->gnd_host_id, &dev->gnd_nid);
02062         if (rc < 0) {
02063                 /* log messages during startup */
02064                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init < GNILND_INIT_ALL) {
02065                         CERROR("couldn't translate host_id 0x%x to nid. rc %d\n",
02066                                 dev->gnd_host_id, rc);
02067                 }
02068                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ESRCH);
02069         }
02070         CDEBUG(D_NET, "NIC %x -> NID %d\n", dev->gnd_host_id, dev->gnd_nid);
02071 
02072         rrc = kgnilnd_cq_create(dev->gnd_handle, *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_credits,
02073                                 0, kgnilnd_device_callback,
02074                                 dev->gnd_id, &dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh);
02075         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02076                 CERROR("Can't create rdma send cq size %u for device "
02077                        "%d (%d)\n", cq_size, dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02078                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02079         }
02080 
02081         rrc = kgnilnd_cq_create(dev->gnd_handle, cq_size,
02082                         0, kgnilnd_device_callback, dev->gnd_id,
02083                         &dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh);
02084         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02085                 CERROR("Can't create fma send cq size %u for device %d (%d)\n",
02086                        cq_size, dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02087                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02088         }
02089 
02090         /* This one we size differently - overflows are possible and it needs to be
02091          * sized based on machine size */
02092         rrc = kgnilnd_cq_create(dev->gnd_handle,
02093                         *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_fma_cq_size,
02094                         0, kgnilnd_device_callback, dev->gnd_id,
02095                         &dev->gnd_rcv_fma_cqh);
02096         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02097                 CERROR("Can't create fma cq size %d for device %d (%d)\n",
02098                        *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_fma_cq_size, dev->gnd_id, rrc);
02099                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02100         }
02101 
02102         rrc = kgnilnd_register_smdd_buf(dev);
02103         if (rrc != GNI_RC_SUCCESS) {
02104                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02105         }
02106 
02107         RETURN(0);
02108 
02109 failed:
02110         kgnilnd_dev_fini(dev);
02111         RETURN(rc);
02112 }
02113 
02114 void
02115 kgnilnd_dev_fini(kgn_device_t *dev)
02116 {
02117         gni_return_t rrc;
02118         ENTRY;
02119 
02120         /* At quiesce or rest time, need to loop through and clear gnd_ready_conns ?*/
02121         LASSERTF(list_empty(&dev->gnd_ready_conns) &&
02122                  list_empty(&dev->gnd_map_tx) &&
02123                  list_empty(&dev->gnd_rdmaq),
02124                  "dev 0x%p ready_conns %d@0x%p map_tx %d@0x%p rdmaq %d@0x%p\n",
02125                  dev, kgnilnd_count_list(&dev->gnd_ready_conns), &dev->gnd_ready_conns,
02126                  kgnilnd_count_list(&dev->gnd_map_tx), &dev->gnd_map_tx,
02127                  kgnilnd_count_list(&dev->gnd_rdmaq), &dev->gnd_rdmaq);
02128 
02129         /* These should follow from tearing down all connections */
02130         LASSERTF(dev->gnd_map_nphys == 0 && dev->gnd_map_physnop == 0,
02131                 "%d physical mappings of %d pages still mapped\n",
02132                  dev->gnd_map_nphys, dev->gnd_map_physnop);
02133 
02134         LASSERTF(dev->gnd_map_nvirt == 0 && dev->gnd_map_virtnob == 0,
02135                 "%d virtual mappings of "LPU64" bytes still mapped\n",
02136                  dev->gnd_map_nvirt, dev->gnd_map_virtnob);
02137 
02138         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd) == 0 &&
02139                  atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd_held) == 0 &&
02140                  atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_nbytes_map) == 0,
02141                 "%d SMSG mappings of %ld bytes still mapped or held %d\n",
02142                  atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd),
02143                  atomic64_read(&dev->gnd_nbytes_map), atomic_read(&dev->gnd_n_mdd_held));
02144 
02145         LASSERT(list_empty(&dev->gnd_map_list));
02146 
02147         /* What other assertions needed to ensure all connections torn down ? */
02148 
02149         /* check all counters == 0 (EP, MDD, etc) */
02150 
02151         /* if we are resetting due to quiese (stack reset), don't check
02152          * thread states */
02153         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger ||
02154                 atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads) == 0,
02155                 "tried to shutdown with threads active\n");
02156 
02157         if (dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf) {
02158                 rrc = kgnilnd_deregister_smdd_buf(dev);
02159                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02160                         "bad rc from deregistion of sMDD buffer: %d\n", rrc);
02161                 dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf = NULL;
02162         }
02163 
02164         if (dev->gnd_rcv_fma_cqh) {
02165                 rrc = kgnilnd_cq_destroy(dev->gnd_rcv_fma_cqh);
02166                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02167                         "bad rc from gni_cq_destroy on rcv_fma_cqh: %d\n", rrc);
02168                 dev->gnd_rcv_fma_cqh = NULL;
02169         }
02170 
02171         if (dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh) {
02172                 rrc = kgnilnd_cq_destroy(dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh);
02173                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02174                         "bad rc from gni_cq_destroy on send_rdma_cqh: %d\n", rrc);
02175                 dev->gnd_snd_rdma_cqh = NULL;
02176         }
02177 
02178         if (dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh) {
02179                 rrc = kgnilnd_cq_destroy(dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh);
02180                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02181                         "bad rc from gni_cq_destroy on snd_fma_cqh: %d\n", rrc);
02182                 dev->gnd_snd_fma_cqh = NULL;
02183         }
02184 
02185         if (dev->gnd_err_handle) {
02186                 rrc = kgnilnd_release_errors(dev->gnd_err_handle);
02187                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02188                         "bad rc from gni_release_errors: %d\n", rrc);
02189                 dev->gnd_err_handle = NULL;
02190         }
02191 
02192         if (dev->gnd_domain) {
02193                 rrc = kgnilnd_cdm_destroy(dev->gnd_domain);
02194                 LASSERTF(rrc == GNI_RC_SUCCESS,
02195                         "bad rc from gni_cdm_destroy: %d\n", rrc);
02196                 dev->gnd_domain = NULL;
02197         }
02198 
02199         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_sock)
02200                 sock_release(kgnilnd_data.kgn_sock);
02201 
02202         EXIT;
02203 }
02204 
02205 int kgnilnd_base_startup(void)
02206 {
02207         struct timeval       tv;
02208         int                  pkmem = atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory);
02209         int                  rc;
02210         int                  i;
02211         kgn_device_t        *dev;
02212         struct task_struct  *thrd;
02213 
02214 #if defined(CONFIG_CRAY_XT) && !defined(CONFIG_CRAY_COMPUTE)
02215         /* limit how much memory can be allocated for fma blocks in
02216          * instances where many nodes need to reconnects at the same time */
02217         struct sysinfo si;
02218         si_meminfo(&si);
02219         kgnilnd_data.free_pages_limit = si.totalram/4;
02220 #endif
02221 
02222         ENTRY;
02223 
02224         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_data.kgn_init == GNILND_INIT_NOTHING,
02225                 "init %d\n", kgnilnd_data.kgn_init);
02226 
02227         /* zero pointers, flags etc */
02228         memset(&kgnilnd_data, 0, sizeof(kgnilnd_data));
02229         kgnilnd_check_kgni_version();
02230 
02231         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: Every 'Fma' message includes the sender's NID and
02232          * a unique (for all time) connstamp so we can uniquely identify
02233          * the sender.  The connstamp is an incrementing counter
02234          * initialised with seconds + microseconds at startup time.  So we
02235          * rely on NOT creating connections more frequently on average than
02236          * 1MHz to ensure we don't use old connstamps when we reboot. */
02237         do_gettimeofday(&tv);
02238         kgnilnd_data.kgn_connstamp =
02239                  kgnilnd_data.kgn_peerstamp =
02240                         (((__u64)tv.tv_sec) * 1000000) + tv.tv_usec;
02241 
02242         init_rwsem(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02243 
02244         for (i = 0; i < GNILND_MAXDEVS; i++) {
02245                 kgn_device_t  *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
02246 
02247                 dev->gnd_id = i;
02248                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_ready_conns);
02249                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_map_tx);
02250                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_fma_buffs);
02251                 mutex_init(&dev->gnd_cq_mutex);
02252                 mutex_init(&dev->gnd_fmablk_mutex);
02253                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_fmablk_lock);
02254                 init_waitqueue_head(&dev->gnd_waitq);
02255                 init_waitqueue_head(&dev->gnd_dgram_waitq);
02256                 init_waitqueue_head(&dev->gnd_dgping_waitq);
02257                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_lock);
02258                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_map_list);
02259                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_map_lock);
02260                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_nfmablk, 0);
02261                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_fmablk_vers, 1);
02262                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_neps, 0);
02263                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_canceled_dgrams, 0);
02264                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_connd_peers);
02265                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_connd_lock);
02266                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_dgram_lock);
02267                 spin_lock_init(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_lock);
02268                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_rdmaq);
02269                 init_rwsem(&dev->gnd_conn_sem);
02270 
02271                 /* alloc & setup nid based dgram table */
02272                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(dev->gnd_dgrams,
02273                             sizeof(struct list_head) * *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02274 
02275                 if (dev->gnd_dgrams == NULL)
02276                         GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02277 
02278                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02279                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dev->gnd_dgrams[i]);
02280                 }
02281                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_ndgrams, 0);
02282                 atomic_set(&dev->gnd_nwcdgrams, 0);
02283                 /* setup timer for RDMAQ processing */
02284                 setup_timer(&dev->gnd_rdmaq_timer, kgnilnd_schedule_device_timer,
02285                             (unsigned long)dev);
02286 
02287                 /* setup timer for mapping processing */
02288                 setup_timer(&dev->gnd_map_timer, kgnilnd_schedule_device_timer,
02289                             (unsigned long)dev);
02290 
02291         }
02292 
02293         /* CQID 0 isn't allowed, set to MAX_MSG_ID - 1 to check for conflicts early */
02294         kgnilnd_data.kgn_next_cqid = GNILND_MAX_MSG_ID - 1;
02295         kgnilnd_data.kgn_new_min_timeout = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout;
02296         init_waitqueue_head(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq);
02297         init_waitqueue_head(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq);
02298         spin_lock_init(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
02299 
02300         mutex_init(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02301         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nquiesce, 0);
02302         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_conns, 0);
02303         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_unlink, 0);
02304         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npending_detach, 0);
02305         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_offset, 0);
02306         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_length, 0);
02307         atomic_set(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_rev_copy_buff, 0);
02308 
02309         /* OK to call kgnilnd_api_shutdown() to cleanup now */
02310         kgnilnd_data.kgn_init = GNILND_INIT_DATA;
02311         try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
02312 
02313         rwlock_init(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peer_conn_lock);
02314 
02315         LIBCFS_ALLOC(kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers,
02316                     sizeof(struct list_head) * *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02317 
02318         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers == NULL)
02319                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02320 
02321         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02322                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i]);
02323         }
02324 
02325         LIBCFS_ALLOC(kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns,
02326                     sizeof(struct list_head) * *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02327 
02328         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns == NULL)
02329                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02330 
02331         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02332                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns[i]);
02333         }
02334 
02335         LIBCFS_ALLOC(kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets,
02336                     sizeof(struct list_head) * *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size);
02337 
02338         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets == NULL)
02339                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02340 
02341         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
02342                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i]);
02343         }
02344 
02345         kgnilnd_data.kgn_mbox_cache =
02346                 kmem_cache_create("kgn_mbox_block", KMALLOC_MAX_SIZE, 0,
02347                                   SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN, NULL);
02348         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_mbox_cache == NULL) {
02349                 CERROR("Can't create slab for physical mbox blocks\n");
02350                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02351         }
02352 
02353         kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache =
02354                 kmem_cache_create("kgn_rx_t", sizeof(kgn_rx_t), 0, 0, NULL);
02355         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache == NULL) {
02356                 CERROR("Can't create slab for kgn_rx_t descriptors\n");
02357                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02358         }
02359 
02360         kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache =
02361                 kmem_cache_create("kgn_tx_t", sizeof(kgn_tx_t), 0, 0, NULL);
02362         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache == NULL) {
02363                 CERROR("Can't create slab for kgn_tx_t\n");
02364                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02365         }
02366 
02367         kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache =
02368                 kmem_cache_create("kgn_tx_phys",
02369                                    LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof(gni_mem_segment_t),
02370                                    0, 0, NULL);
02371         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache == NULL) {
02372                 CERROR("Can't create slab for kgn_tx_phys\n");
02373                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02374         }
02375 
02376         kgnilnd_data.kgn_dgram_cache =
02377                 kmem_cache_create("kgn_dgram_t", sizeof(kgn_dgram_t), 0, 0, NULL);
02378         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_dgram_cache == NULL) {
02379                 CERROR("Can't create slab for outgoing datagrams\n");
02380                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02381         }
02382 
02383         /* allocate a MAX_IOV array of page pointers for each cpu */
02384         kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages = kmalloc(num_possible_cpus() * sizeof (struct page *),
02385                                                    GFP_KERNEL);
02386         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages == NULL) {
02387                 CERROR("Can't allocate vmap cksum pages\n");
02388                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02389         }
02390         kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_npages = num_possible_cpus();
02391         memset(kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages, 0,
02392                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_npages * sizeof (struct page *));
02393 
02394         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_npages; i++) {
02395                 kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages[i] = kmalloc(LNET_MAX_IOV * sizeof (struct page *),
02396                                                               GFP_KERNEL);
02397                 if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages[i] == NULL) {
02398                         CERROR("Can't allocate vmap cksum pages for cpu %d\n", i);
02399                         GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02400                 }
02401         }
02402 
02403         LASSERT(kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs == 0);
02404 
02405         /* Use all available GNI devices */
02406         for (i = 0; i < GNILND_MAXDEVS; i++) {
02407                 dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs];
02408 
02409                 rc = kgnilnd_dev_init(dev);
02410                 if (rc == 0) {
02411                         /* Increment here so base_shutdown cleans it up */
02412                         kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs++;
02413 
02414                         rc = kgnilnd_allocate_phys_fmablk(dev);
02415                         if (rc)
02416                                 GOTO(failed, rc);
02417                 }
02418         }
02419 
02420         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs == 0) {
02421                 CERROR("Can't initialise any GNI devices\n");
02422                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENODEV);
02423         }
02424 
02425         rc = kgnilnd_thread_start(kgnilnd_reaper, NULL, "kgnilnd_rpr", 0);
02426         if (rc != 0) {
02427                 CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd reaper: %d\n", rc);
02428                 GOTO(failed, rc);
02429         }
02430 
02431         rc = kgnilnd_start_rca_thread();
02432         if (rc != 0) {
02433                 CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd rca: %d\n", rc);
02434                 GOTO(failed, rc);
02435         }
02436 
02437         /*
02438          * Start ruhroh thread.  We can't use kgnilnd_thread_start() because
02439          * we don't want this thread included in kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads
02440          * count.  This thread controls quiesce, so it mustn't
02441          * quiesce itself.
02442          */
02443         thrd = kthread_run(kgnilnd_ruhroh_thread, NULL, "%s_%02d", "kgnilnd_rr", 0);
02444         if (IS_ERR(thrd)) {
02445                 rc = PTR_ERR(thrd);
02446                 CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd ruhroh thread: %d\n", rc);
02447                 GOTO(failed, rc);
02448         }
02449 
02450         /* threads will load balance across devs as they are available */
02451         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_thread_affinity) {
02452                 rc = kgnilnd_start_sd_threads();
02453                 if (rc != 0)
02454                         GOTO(failed, rc);
02455         } else {
02456                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_sched_threads; i++) {
02457                         rc = kgnilnd_thread_start(kgnilnd_scheduler,
02458                                                   (void *)((long)i),
02459                                                   "kgnilnd_sd", i);
02460                         if (rc != 0) {
02461                                 CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd scheduler[%d]: %d\n",
02462                                        i, rc);
02463                                 GOTO(failed, rc);
02464                         }
02465                 }
02466         }
02467 
02468         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
02469                 dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
02470                 rc = kgnilnd_thread_start(kgnilnd_dgram_mover, dev,
02471                                           "kgnilnd_dg", dev->gnd_id);
02472                 if (rc != 0) {
02473                         CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd dgram_mover[%d]: %d\n",
02474                                dev->gnd_id, rc);
02475                         GOTO(failed, rc);
02476                 }
02477 
02478                 rc = kgnilnd_thread_start(kgnilnd_dgram_waitq, dev,
02479                                           "kgnilnd_dgn", dev->gnd_id);
02480                 if (rc != 0) {
02481                         CERROR("Can't spawn gnilnd dgram_waitq[%d]: %d\n",
02482                                 dev->gnd_id, rc);
02483                         GOTO(failed, rc);
02484                 }
02485 
02486                 rc = kgnilnd_setup_wildcard_dgram(dev);
02487 
02488                 if (rc != 0) {
02489                         CERROR("Can't create wildcard dgrams[%d]: %d\n",
02490                                 dev->gnd_id, rc);
02491                         GOTO(failed, rc);
02492                 }
02493         }
02494 
02495         /* flag everything initialised */
02496         kgnilnd_data.kgn_init = GNILND_INIT_ALL;
02497         /*****************************************************/
02498 
02499         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "initial kmem %d\n", pkmem);
02500         RETURN(0);
02501 
02502 failed:
02503         kgnilnd_base_shutdown();
02504         kgnilnd_data.kgn_init = GNILND_INIT_NOTHING;
02505         RETURN(rc);
02506 }
02507 
02508 void
02509 kgnilnd_base_shutdown(void)
02510 {
02511         int                     i, j;
02512         ENTRY;
02513 
02514         while (CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(CFS_FAIL_GNI_PAUSE_SHUTDOWN, 1)) {};
02515 
02516         kgnilnd_data.kgn_wc_kill = 1;
02517 
02518         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
02519                 kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
02520                 kgnilnd_cancel_wc_dgrams(dev);
02521                 kgnilnd_cancel_dgrams(dev);
02522                 kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(NULL, LNET_NID_ANY, GNILND_DEL_PEER, -ESHUTDOWN);
02523                 kgnilnd_wait_for_canceled_dgrams(dev);
02524         }
02525 
02526         /* We need to verify there are no conns left before we let the threads
02527          * shut down otherwise we could clean up the peers but still have
02528          * some outstanding conns due to orphaned datagram conns that are
02529          * being cleaned up.
02530          */
02531         i = 2;
02532         while (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns) != 0) {
02533                 i++;
02534 
02535                 for(j = 0; j < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; ++j) {
02536                         kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[j];
02537                         kgnilnd_schedule_device(dev);
02538                 }
02539 
02540                 CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02541                         "Waiting for conns to be cleaned up %d\n",atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns));
02542                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02543                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02544         }
02545         /* Peer state all cleaned up BEFORE setting shutdown, so threads don't
02546          * have to worry about shutdown races.  NB connections may be created
02547          * while there are still active connds, but these will be temporary
02548          * since peer creation always fails after the listener has started to
02549          * shut down.
02550          * all peers should have been cleared out on the nets */
02551         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers) == 0,
02552                 "peers left %d\n", atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers));
02553 
02554         /* Wait for the ruhroh thread to shut down. */
02555         kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_shutdown = 1;
02556         wake_up(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_waitq);
02557         i = 2;
02558         while (kgnilnd_data.kgn_ruhroh_running != 0) {
02559                 i++;
02560                 CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02561                        "Waiting for ruhroh thread to terminate\n");
02562                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02563                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02564         }
02565 
02566        /* Flag threads to terminate */
02567         kgnilnd_data.kgn_shutdown = 1;
02568 
02569         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
02570                 kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
02571 
02572                 /* should clear all the MDDs */
02573                 kgnilnd_unmap_fma_blocks(dev);
02574 
02575                 kgnilnd_schedule_device(dev);
02576                 wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_dgram_waitq);
02577                 wake_up_all(&dev->gnd_dgping_waitq);
02578                 LASSERT(list_empty(&dev->gnd_connd_peers));
02579         }
02580 
02581         spin_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
02582         wake_up_all(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_waitq);
02583         spin_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_reaper_lock);
02584 
02585         if (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads))
02586                 kgnilnd_wakeup_rca_thread();
02587 
02588         /* Wait for threads to exit */
02589         i = 2;
02590         while (atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads) != 0) {
02591                 i++;
02592                 CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET, /* power of 2? */
02593                        "Waiting for %d threads to terminate\n",
02594                        atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nthreads));
02595                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02596                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02597         }
02598 
02599         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers) == 0,
02600                 "peers left %d\n", atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_npeers));
02601 
02602         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers != NULL) {
02603                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++)
02604                         LASSERT(list_empty(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers[i]));
02605 
02606                 LIBCFS_FREE(kgnilnd_data.kgn_peers,
02607                             sizeof (struct list_head) *
02608                             *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02609         }
02610 
02611         down_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02612         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets != NULL) {
02613                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++)
02614                         LASSERT(list_empty(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i]));
02615 
02616                 LIBCFS_FREE(kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets,
02617                             sizeof (struct list_head) *
02618                             *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size);
02619         }
02620         up_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02621 
02622         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns) == 0,
02623                 "conns left %d\n", atomic_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nconns));
02624 
02625         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns != NULL) {
02626                 for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++)
02627                         LASSERT(list_empty(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns[i]));
02628 
02629                 LIBCFS_FREE(kgnilnd_data.kgn_conns,
02630                             sizeof (struct list_head) *
02631                             *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02632         }
02633 
02634         for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_ndevs; i++) {
02635                 kgn_device_t *dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[i];
02636                 kgnilnd_dev_fini(dev);
02637 
02638                 LASSERTF(atomic_read(&dev->gnd_ndgrams) == 0,
02639                         "dgrams left %d\n", atomic_read(&dev->gnd_ndgrams));
02640 
02641                 if (dev->gnd_dgrams != NULL) {
02642                         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size; i++)
02643                                 LASSERT(list_empty(&dev->gnd_dgrams[i]));
02644 
02645                         LIBCFS_FREE(dev->gnd_dgrams,
02646                                     sizeof (struct list_head) *
02647                                     *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_hash_size);
02648                 }
02649 
02650                 kgnilnd_free_phys_fmablk(dev);
02651         }
02652 
02653         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_mbox_cache != NULL)
02654                 kmem_cache_destroy(kgnilnd_data.kgn_mbox_cache);
02655 
02656         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache != NULL)
02657                 kmem_cache_destroy(kgnilnd_data.kgn_rx_cache);
02658 
02659         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache != NULL)
02660                 kmem_cache_destroy(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_cache);
02661 
02662         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache != NULL)
02663                 kmem_cache_destroy(kgnilnd_data.kgn_tx_phys_cache);
02664 
02665         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_dgram_cache != NULL)
02666                 kmem_cache_destroy(kgnilnd_data.kgn_dgram_cache);
02667 
02668         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages != NULL) {
02669                 for (i = 0; i < kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_npages; i++) {
02670                         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages[i] != NULL) {
02671                                 kfree(kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages[i]);
02672                         }
02673                 }
02674                 kfree(kgnilnd_data.kgn_cksum_map_pages);
02675         }
02676 
02677         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "after NAL cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02678                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02679 
02680         kgnilnd_data.kgn_init = GNILND_INIT_NOTHING;
02681         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
02682 
02683         EXIT;
02684 }
02685 
02686 int
02687 kgnilnd_startup(lnet_ni_t *ni)
02688 {
02689         int               rc, devno;
02690         kgn_net_t        *net;
02691         ENTRY;
02692 
02693         LASSERTF(ni->ni_lnd == &the_kgnilnd,
02694                 "bad LND 0x%p != the_kgnilnd @ 0x%p\n",
02695                 ni->ni_lnd, &the_kgnilnd);
02696 
02697         if (kgnilnd_data.kgn_init == GNILND_INIT_NOTHING) {
02698                 rc = kgnilnd_base_startup();
02699                 if (rc != 0)
02700                         RETURN(rc);
02701         }
02702 
02703         /* Serialize with shutdown. */
02704         mutex_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02705 
02706         LIBCFS_ALLOC(net, sizeof(*net));
02707         if (net == NULL) {
02708                 CERROR("could not allocate net for new interface instance\n");
02709                 /* no need to cleanup the CDM... */
02710                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02711         }
02712         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&net->gnn_list);
02713         ni->ni_data = net;
02714         net->gnn_ni = ni;
02715         ni->ni_maxtxcredits = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_credits;
02716         ni->ni_peertxcredits = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_credits;
02717 
02718         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_health) {
02719                 int     fudge;
02720                 int     timeout;
02721                 /* give this a bit of leeway - we don't have a hard timeout
02722                  * as we only check timeouts periodically - see comment in kgnilnd_reaper */
02723                 fudge = (GNILND_TO2KA(*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout) / GNILND_REAPER_NCHECKS);
02724                 timeout = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_timeout + fudge;
02725 
02726                 if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_timeout >= timeout)
02727                         ni->ni_peertimeout = *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_timeout;
02728                 else if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_timeout > -1) {
02729                         LCONSOLE_ERROR("Peer_timeout is set to %d but needs to be >= %d\n",
02730                                         *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_peer_timeout,
02731                                         timeout);
02732                         ni->ni_data = NULL;
02733                         LIBCFS_FREE(net, sizeof(*net));
02734                         GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02735                 } else
02736                         ni->ni_peertimeout = timeout;
02737 
02738                 LCONSOLE_INFO("Enabling LNet peer health for gnilnd, timeout %ds\n",
02739                               ni->ni_peertimeout);
02740         }
02741 
02742         atomic_set(&net->gnn_refcount, 1);
02743 
02744         /* if we have multiple devices, spread the nets around */
02745         net->gnn_netnum = LNET_NETNUM(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid));
02746 
02747         devno = LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid) % GNILND_MAXDEVS;
02748         net->gnn_dev = &kgnilnd_data.kgn_devices[devno];
02749 
02750         /* allocate a 'dummy' cdm for datagram use. We can only have a single
02751          * datagram between a nid:inst_id and nid2:inst_id. The fake cdm
02752          * give us additional inst_id to use, allowing the datagrams to flow
02753          * like rivers of honey and beer */
02754 
02755         /* the instance id for the cdm is the NETNUM offset by MAXDEVS -
02756          * ensuring we'll have a unique id */
02757 
02758 
02759         ni->ni_nid = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid), net->gnn_dev->gnd_nid);
02760         CDEBUG(D_NET, "adding net %p nid=%s on dev %d \n",
02761                 net, libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), net->gnn_dev->gnd_id);
02762         /* until the gnn_list is set, we need to cleanup ourselves as
02763          * kgnilnd_shutdown is just gonna get confused */
02764 
02765         down_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02766         list_add_tail(&net->gnn_list, kgnilnd_netnum2netlist(net->gnn_netnum));
02767         up_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02768 
02769         /* we need a separate thread to call probe_wait_by_id until
02770          * we get a function callback notifier from kgni */
02771         mutex_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02772         RETURN(0);
02773  failed:
02774         mutex_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02775         kgnilnd_shutdown(ni);
02776         RETURN(rc);
02777 }
02778 
02779 void
02780 kgnilnd_shutdown(lnet_ni_t *ni)
02781 {
02782         kgn_net_t     *net = ni->ni_data;
02783         int           i;
02784         int           rc;
02785         ENTRY;
02786 
02787         CFS_RACE(CFS_FAIL_GNI_SR_DOWN_RACE);
02788 
02789         LASSERTF(kgnilnd_data.kgn_init == GNILND_INIT_ALL,
02790                 "init %d\n", kgnilnd_data.kgn_init);
02791 
02792         /* Serialize with startup. */
02793         mutex_lock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02794         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "before NAL cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02795                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02796 
02797         if (net == NULL) {
02798                 CERROR("got NULL net for ni %p\n", ni);
02799                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02800         }
02801 
02802         LASSERTF(ni == net->gnn_ni,
02803                 "ni %p gnn_ni %p\n", net, net->gnn_ni);
02804 
02805         ni->ni_data = NULL;
02806 
02807         LASSERT(!net->gnn_shutdown);
02808         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount) != 0,
02809                 "net %p refcount %d\n",
02810                  net, atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount));
02811 
02812         if (!list_empty(&net->gnn_list)) {
02813                 /* serialize with peer creation */
02814                 down_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02815                 net->gnn_shutdown = 1;
02816                 up_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02817 
02818                 kgnilnd_cancel_net_dgrams(net);
02819 
02820                 kgnilnd_del_conn_or_peer(net, LNET_NID_ANY, GNILND_DEL_PEER, -ESHUTDOWN);
02821 
02822                 /* if we are quiesced, need to wake up - we need those threads
02823                  * alive to release peers, etc */
02824                 if (GNILND_IS_QUIESCED) {
02825                         set_mb(kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_trigger, GNILND_QUIESCE_IDLE);
02826                         kgnilnd_quiesce_wait("shutdown");
02827                 }
02828 
02829                 kgnilnd_wait_for_canceled_dgrams(net->gnn_dev);
02830 
02831                 /* We wait until the nets ref's are 1, we will release final ref which is ours
02832                  * this allows us to make sure everything else is done before we free the
02833                  * net.
02834                  */
02835                 i = 4;
02836                 while (atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount) != 1) {
02837                         i++;
02838                         CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02839                                 "Waiting for %d references to clear on net %d\n",
02840                                 atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount),
02841                                 net->gnn_netnum);
02842                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02843                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02844                 }
02845 
02846                 /* release ref from kgnilnd_startup */
02847                 kgnilnd_net_decref(net);
02848                 /* serialize with reaper and conn_task looping */
02849                 down_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02850                 list_del_init(&net->gnn_list);
02851                 up_write(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02852 
02853         }
02854 
02855         /* not locking, this can't race with writers */
02856         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount) == 0,
02857                 "net %p refcount %d\n",
02858                  net, atomic_read(&net->gnn_refcount));
02859         LIBCFS_FREE(net, sizeof(*net));
02860 
02861 out:
02862         down_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02863         for (i = 0; i < *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size; i++) {
02864                 if (!list_empty(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_nets[i])) {
02865                         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02866                         break;
02867                 }
02868 
02869                 if (i == *kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_net_hash_size - 1) {
02870                         up_read(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_net_rw_sem);
02871                         kgnilnd_base_shutdown();
02872                 }
02873         }
02874         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "after NAL cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02875                atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
02876 
02877         mutex_unlock(&kgnilnd_data.kgn_quiesce_mutex);
02878         EXIT;
02879 }
02880 
02881 static void __exit kgnilnd_exit(void)
02882 {
02883         lnet_unregister_lnd(&the_kgnilnd);
02884         kgnilnd_proc_fini();
02885         kgnilnd_remove_sysctl();
02886 }
02887 
02888 static int __init kgnilnd_init(void)
02889 {
02890         int    rc;
02891 
02892         rc = kgnilnd_tunables_init();
02893         if (rc != 0)
02894                 return rc;
02895 
02896         printk(KERN_INFO "Lustre: kgnilnd build version: "KGNILND_BUILD_REV"\n");
02897 
02898         kgnilnd_insert_sysctl();
02899         kgnilnd_proc_init();
02900 
02901         lnet_register_lnd(&the_kgnilnd);
02902 
02903         return 0;
02904 }
02905 
02906 MODULE_AUTHOR("Cray, Inc. <nic@cray.com>");
02907 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Gemini LNet Network Driver");
02908 MODULE_VERSION(KGNILND_BUILD_REV);
02909 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
02910 
02911 module_init(kgnilnd_init);
02912 module_exit(kgnilnd_exit);
